11523333.title: Some Spooky Choices

115233332.content:
Link couldn't believe how bad it became; how outclassed he was. He'd collected 23 masks but they all seemed useless against just this one. While he fared well enough against Majora's Mask, when it transformed into a lanky humanoid cyclops, things got bad. It moved too fast, attacked relentlessly, and Link could barely keep up with it.

He was forced to don the Goron's mask and chase it down. The fight was erratic and Link was constantly bouncing off walls. But eventually he defeated this new form. But it only got worse from there. The monster's arms and legs bulged in mass. Its face became more demonic and menacing. And from the tips of its hands, two long whip-like tentacles grew.

It's new form was much stronger and more direct. Link couldn't even get close to it to attack, without either getting kicked away or ensnared with the whip, and flung across the room. The crack of each whip was a stinging lash. They left sore, red bruises, and some were powerful enough to draw blood. Link could only stop its assault by stunning it with a light arrow. But by the time Link had sprinted close enough to attack, Majora had already recovered. It leaped across the chamber, laughing at Link as it did.

Link was tired, and fatigued...He couldn't even catch this thing. And what's worse, using the Goron form to fight Majora's previous shape, had drained most of his magic. He didn't have enough for anymore light arrows. He realized he had to change strategies. The Bunnyhood managed to speed him up to where he could get close enough, but Majora still jumped away. And worse, when it landed this time, it cracked a whip on the top of Link's head, snapping the bunnyhood in half, and whipping the pieces from his head.

Link decided to try a stealthy approach. He donned the Stonesmask. Knowing that it made him invisible to other enemies, he'd hoped Majora didn't see him. The monster stood up straight and turned its head from side to side trying to see where Link went. It was working! He slowly crept toward the monster. Majora turned around to examine the room behind it. This was his chance. He crept up behind it, hoping to stab it or slash its legs clean off.
Majora suddenly turned and backhanded Link away, knocking him to the ground. Stunned from the attack, Link couldn't flee before Majora suddenly stopped a foot on his tiny body, pinning him to the floor. With another crack of the whip, the Stonesmask flew off, and Link returned to visible view. Majora then lifted its foot and kicked him away.

Majora then spotted the bag where Link kept all of his equipment, including his masks. It cracked the whip at him, and knocked the bag away. Link was in trouble now. He didn't have any of his weapons and had lost most of his masks. He only had three left; the transformation masks.

He was about to use one, when suddenly, Majora tensed up. It began swaying while holding it's head; like it was dizzy or something. Suddenly the dark purple and red skin began to crack like an eggshell. A bright light shined between the cracks and it looked like Majora was falling apart. Had Link's light arrow somehow had a delayed reaction? Had he defeated it?

This was unfortunately a short-lived belief, as suddenly the monster's body exploded, revealing it to be only an outer-shell. A smaller being that was inside, was now revealed, standing in the middle of the bitch black smoke. Link began to ponder that somehow, Majora's other forms were somehow cocoons. And if it had now broken free, then this was to be the main attraction...And what an attraction it was.

...Majora was a Woman!

Link blinked his eyes to make sure he was seeing it right. It didn't seem real or even possible. But there she was; standing in the almost living darkness of black smoke was a woman. And worse; she didn't look injured at all from their battle. It was like transforming had healed her. Link took a moment to notice her; she was unlike any of the monsters he'd faced yet. Her skin was a lavender color, whereas her hair was a dark purple. Her lips were painted a matching purple color, with eye-shadow to match. Her face had red and green markings, that were reminiscent of the mask...And her eyes were a piercing red.

The smoke around her suddenly drew inward and began to cling to her body. Amazed, Link saw that the smoke was now becoming clothes, modestly hiding her form. She wore a long flowing purple dress skirt that rose only up over her hips. Her midriff remained exposed. Her chest was soon covered in an armored breast-plate that resembled the mask itself, complete with two glowing orange eyes over her bosom. The pads on her shoulders were covered in spikes.
The smoke began to braid parts of her hair, and pull it back. And finally the smoke finished by forming a spiky tiara on her head, almost like a crown. The spikes wrapped around her face near her long Hylian ears. And the final touch was a thin band that wrapped around her forehead, with a yellow gem in the center.

She slowly raised her head and stared at Link. There was something odd about her gaze. She was beautiful and threatening at the same time. She slowly began to examine herself. "How fortuitous this is," she spoke to him. "I must admit I was worried when the life force I drained from the Imp wasn't enough to fully revive me. But the remains of my fallen servants had just enough left in them for me to take. Thank you for bringing them back to me. The life energy I stole from you was also helpful."

Link glared and gritted his teeth at her. He was in no mood to be told how much he'd helped this creature.
"Link," Tatl whispered. "This new form is definitely more dangerous; you have to keep your focus. Try stunning her and then attack before she can recover."

Link immediately donned the Zora's Mask, taking the form of Mikau. He immediately threw his boomerang fins and sprinted toward Majora. The two fins began to fly at her from the sides while Link charged her from the front...Majora was moving faster than all three of them. She immediately grew a tentacle whip from one of her arms. Twirling it in the air, she swatted the boomerangs away. Link jumped into the air, preparing to flip-kick her. She cracked her whip forward, wrapping around his leg, yanking back on it, pulling Link out of his jump. She then twirled it around and slammed him onto the ground.

Before Link could recover, she snapped her whip at his face. The stinging impact somehow whipped the Zora's mask from him reverting him back to his Hylian form. Link went down, face stinging from the attack. The Zora's mask had failed, and was now out of reach. Majora slowly began to approach. She was smiling. Part of him felt like she was enjoying this; like she was merely playing with him.
He got back up and donned the Goron's Mask, taking the form of Darmani. He charged her and threw a flaming fist at her face. But she raised one of her petite hands to stop it. Link couldn't believe how strong she was. But before he could attack again, she pulled him forward and punched him in the stomach, knocking him away. She approached. As he began to sit up, he was greeted with her reaching toward his face. With a painful wrench, she pulled the Goron's mask off of him, reverting him back to normal. She then tossed it aside and took a few steps back, waiting for Link to rise.

"Link, you can't take much more of this," Tatl whispered to him.

"Well there isn't much I can do," he retorted under his breath. "It's not like I can run away; plus we're working against the clock."

"I know; but we need to formulate a plan," Tatl said. "Those floral patterns on the floor; they act as Deku flowers. If you take your Deku form, you can hide in one, where she won't be able to touch you. You can recover your strength, and we'll figure out a plan down there."

Link liked the idea, and readied himself. He quickly rolled toward the nearest flower and donned the Deku Mask. He immediately burrowed into the flower, and quietly sat underground, trying to catch his breath. Majora however wasn't deterred by this action. She merely stood over the flower. The aforementioned tentacle slithered like a snake into the hole. Since it was so dark inside, Link didn't know what hit him until it was too late. The tentacle wrapped around him and ripped him out of the ground like a weed.

Majora raised Link up to her face. The tentacle constricted even tighter, squeezing Link until his face turned red and his eyes teared up. Finally the Deku Mask seemed to pop off of his face. It dropped to the ground and Majora kicked it away. She loosened her grip on Link for only a moment, allowing him to catch his breath. He tried raising his sword to attack her. But she tossed him away.
"Naughty Boys," Majora began to say. A second whip grew from her other arm. "Need to be punished!"

She suddenly began whipping Link with both whips; mercilessly and swiftly snapping them up and down over his body. Each crack of her whips was a painful sting that beat his body. When she was finally finished, Link didn't have the strength in his arm to even hold his sword anymore.

She walked up to Link slowly and stood over him. Her tentacles wrapped around him and lifted him off the ground. She used her hand to turn his head to face her. "You were the last thing to stand in my way," she said. "You gave all those people down there a hope that you could not possibly live up to. There is no way you could stop me, boy. The moon is going to break those giants any moment now...And as amusing as a whipping-boy you've made so far...I believe our little game is at an end."

"Fine...I know when I'm beat," Link said. "Just make it quick."

"Oh, I won't do that," Majora said. "It's no fun..."

"Then...what are you going to do?" Link asked, now a little afraid of even more pain.

"I told you before that I shall consume everything," Majora told him. "...It seems fitting I should start with you."

123.title: Link's Energetic Little Sister

1231.content:
Peering toward the twin silhouettes of Outset Island, Aryll saw two glowing orange orbs- the setting sun between the massive black plateaus, and the shimmering congregation of paper lanterns hung in front of her house. She lied against the King of Red Lions’ curved neck and looked on. Rolling wind wafted the scent of saltwater into her nose, followed by the fiery smell of charcoal swept from Outset’s beach. Aryll took a deep breath and turned toward the stern and saw her brother, Link. He was clad in his blue crawfish shirt and orange pants, happy to get a break from adventuring. She wore her usual cyan, flower-speckled dress. Bar the celebration and boat ride, it was a day like any other for the two siblings. Link smiled, gripping the rudder and steering the boat toward the island, toward the celebration. The wind caught the King of Red Lions’ sails and thrust the craft through the calm sea water.

“Aww,” Aryll whined, “big brother, can’t we stay out a little longer?”

Link sighed. “Come on, Aryll! We’ve been out for half an hour, and I still haven’t eaten!”

He was right. “…I know, I know. Sorry, big brother.”

Link tilted his head to the side, offering that warm, reassuring smile that Aryll loved. “Hey, don’t worry about it. Let’s go and get some food, right sis?”

“Mm-hm,” Aryll nodded, her stomach groaning in agreement. She forced a smile, but the truth was that she couldn’t feel anything but anxiety. Having vanquished the King of Darkness and rescued Tetra, Link’s plans were set on joining the pirates for continued adventures in the uncharted seas. Aryll was not afraid for her brother’s safety; she knew he could handle himself. She had admired his strength since her earliest memories of him. Even though he could be lazy, Link was always there for her. Even an army of monsters didn’t stop him from rescuing her. He was so tough, and brave, and affectionate…

…And when the sun rose tomorrow, he’d be gone forever.

The King of Red Lions’ sail retracted as it reached the dock. Link held his sister’s hand and helped her off the boat. Aryll loved how considerate he was, even though she was fully capable of disembarking herself. The siblings walked back toward their house and sat down at the picnic table and dug into the spread of ham and vegetables. Link was sure to pass his sister the spices and sauces, just like when they were little kids. Aryll licked her lips as they zesty flavor exploded over her tongue. She reached out in all directions, grabbing chunks of food and stuffing her face. Each meaty gulp produced a subtle lump in her throat before settling in her stomach. The pirates watched her in fascination. Niko in particular was stunned; “I can’t believe such a little girl can pack away such a big meal!”

Even Tetra was impressed. “Wow, Niko. Last time I heard anyone say that was the first time you went to Windfall Café.”

A storm of hearty laughter, from islanders and pirates alike, roared into the warm night at the diminutive pirate’s expense. Aryll leaned into Link and giggled. Her brother chuckled too, running his fingers through her hair. She loved him so much…

…And tomorrow, he’d be gone.

Later that night, the full moon hung high and the whole island had fallen asleep. Everyone, from the townspeople to the pirates, was snoring away.

For old times’ sake, Link had chosen to sleep in the house he had grown up in. He, Aryll, and their grandmother were sitting in the candlelit kitchen by the stewpot. They dined on grandma’s soup as Link told stories about his adventures. Or, to be more accurate, Link and grandma had taken a couple sips as Aryll greedily slurped her third bowl. “Don’t have too much, dear,” grandma warned, “you don’t wanna wake up in the middle of the night for some emergency relief!”

Aryll blushed profusely. “G-grandma! You’re embarrassing me!”

Link laughed. “Hey, we’re the only ones here, Aryll! But grandma’s right… You sure did eat a lot.”

“You think so,” Aryll said, lifting up her skirt and poking her potbelly, feeling the digested slop slosh about within. “I dunno, I felt like I could eat an octorok!”

“Heh, maybe you should go to an eating contest on Windfall. I hear those rich folks give out crazy… prizes…” Link reached toward the ceiling and yawned. “…Man, I’m ready to sleep.”

Grandma followed suit with an exasperated yawn. “Yes, I’m feeling rather exhausted myself.”

Link and grandma rose from the table, heading to their respective bedrooms. Aryll sat still and watched her brother and grandmother shamble off to bed. “G’night Aryll, g’night grandma. That was a fun party...”

Grandma hummed in agreement as she shut her bedroom door. Link waved to Aryll as he, too, reached his sleeping quarters. She was left alone in the dim candlelight. Only her thoughts kept her company now. Those thoughts drifted to her brother, naturally. She had so much fun. She didn’t want the day to end, but it was already over. She was still full of energy… And hunger, strangely enough. When Aryll said she could eat an octorok, she wasn’t kidding. She could have easily drank the whole stewpot, but she simply didn’t feel like it. Aryll wanted something more filling. And at the exact same time, she wanted her brother to stay.

The blue-skirted girl never thought those two desires could ever correlate, yet here she sat, wanting two things: to fill her belly and to keep Link forever. To combine them was impossible, though. She knew there was no way she could fit Link into her stomach, no matter how hungry she was. But she did know one of Gonzo’s legendarily strange pirate stories. One that centered on an island of warrior women who could eat men whole… Wait, was that really one of Gonzo’s stories? And was Aryll really standing, waddling over toward Link’s room…?

The answer to at least one of those questions was “Yes.” Aryll clutched the doorknob, slowly opening the door and peering inside. The shaft of faint light cast from the doorway revealed Link, in his white nightshirt and pants, splayed out on the messy bedsheets. He was already deep in slumber, his unkempt blonde hair wildly spread over his pillow. He snored lightly. Aryll looked to the front of the bed and saw his bare feet dangling off the edge. Those wrinkled soles, those curling toes… She couldn’t deny it any longer. Aryll’s tongue ran over her lips. Her brother looked delicious.

But could she really bring herself to devour him?

In fact, the strain now felt rather pleasant. As she felt her distended cheeks, Aryll found that Link’s entire foot now occupied her mouth. His toes tickled her uvula but did not trigger a gag reflex. His hefty heel pressed down into her tongue. His wrinkly insole tasted even more scrumptious than she could have imagined as her tongue busily lapped at it. It was mouthwatering, like sea salt and spice. If she could have gasped she would have. Somehow, she had unhinged her jaw and fit her brother’s entire foot in her mouth.

“I… I did it… His whole foot! Wow!”

Naturally, her gaze drifted over toward Link’s right foot. “I wonder… Could I?” Concluding that there was no way to know without trying, Aryll grabbed the ankle and opened her mouth even wider, enough to stretch her lips over the other foot. Slowly but surely, her maw began to engulf Link’s right foot, advancing over the toes, sole, and finally, the heel and base of the ankle. Link’s feet were now mashed together inside her mouth. Her cheeks to ballooned out, each the size of her fist.

“Mmmmmmh,” the girl heartily moaned, feeling the wonderful taste double in potency. But she then looked both of Link’s ankles, which merged into the bridge of her nose and vanished into her mouth. Aryll’s face was starting to hurt again. She winced as Link tossed and turned a bit in his sleep. The slight movements shot pain throughout her mouth. “Maybe,” she wondered, “maybe this is as far as I can go…”

Aryll’s stomach disagreed, howling to be properly filled. “B-but there’s no way… He’s too big.” She snorted. She could still regurgitate his feet, turn back and go to sleep. But even if that ended being the case, Aryll wanted to make this moment last. “If my insides are stretchy, I bet I can at least get to his ankles,” she thought. Aryll tilted her head back and took a small gulp. She pulled herself forward, onto the end of the bed. Her gullet expanded to suck Link’s feet down. Aryll massaged the bulge in her throat. Her lips now formed a fleshy ring around Link’s forelegs while the sphincter of her throat gripped his ankles. She was surprised at how much she managed to devour. Aryll was now staring at Link’s knees, with his silk-clad thighs and pelvis stretching tantalizingly beyond. His bellybutton peeked out from behind his white nightshirt. He felt so… Strong. Aryll felt powerful, almost maternal, to have any of Link’s muscular form inside her.

She wanted more.

“M-maybe just up to his thighs,” she thought, “that way I can… I can still let him go at the end.”

Aryll now took might, sequential swallows. Each gulp stretched her lips just a little father as they expanded over his ample hips. Her neck now held a fat, tubular bulge that brushed against the bedsheets. Her chest was now on the bed, growing with Link’s legs inside. Aryll advanced over Link’s body like a snake swallowing a rodent, yet she was smaller than he. She shuddered as she felt Link’s toes tickle the sphincter leading into her belly. She hadn’t even reached the apex of Link’s hips and she already felt like she’d reached another roadblock. It felt like trying to stretch her mouth over a hill, or even a mountain. “M-maybe I should give up now… This is good enough.”

Her belly roared in disagreement. “No, no… I can do this! Big brother, you’re going straight to my belly!” The sphincter in front of her stomach suddenly dilated. Link’s feet almost fell inside, speeding the process of devouring him along considerably. Aryll’s muscular throat rippled and clenched, squeezing more of Link’s legs into her bulging belly. A particularly meaty gulp got her over the widest point of Link’s thighs. She had conquered the hill, and now she was permitted to descend into the valley below. Aryll practically crawled over Link’s bed, easily swallowing halfway up his waist. Her stomach had expanded into a peach sphere that tore her dress open. From an overhead view, it would almost look as though Link was lying in a fleshy sleeping bag.

Link’s shoulders would be Aryll’s final challenge. To ease the burden, she grabbed his hands and slid them under her lips, pinning them to his sides and beginning their journey into her belly. She proceeded to eating his chest and arms. By now her stomach had now expanded far beyond its physical limits. She lied upon its rounded form like a beanbag. It sank into the soft mattress. Aryll felt like she was lying on two beds at once. Link’s legs were fully sealed inside her stomach. His midsection was well on its way. His torso had just finished entering her mouth as she conquered those broad shoulders… Her lips sealed around the base of his neck.

Before long, only Link’s head remained in Aryll’s gob. His face was bordered by his sister’s lips, like a fleshy picture frame. Aryll took a moment to admire her work. Through sheer willpower, burning love, and roaring hunger, she had sent her brother sliding into her soft, squishy innards. There, he would be safe. He would be hers, never to sail away. He would always be at her side, lending her his strength. She ran her tongue over his face, enjoying his taste one last time. Unable to wait any longer, Aryll threw her head back, her lips sealing over her brother’s placidly slumbering face. Using her tongue, she pushed Link’s head back into her gullet, leaving only a single muscular contraction to seal his fate.

*GULP!*

Link’s upper body dove down her gullet, spilling into Aryll’s belly. The head-shaped bulge distended her neck before being lost behind her ribcage, funneled into the constrictive stomach. Inside his sister’s bulbous gut, he curled into a fetal position. Aryll sighed happily, stifling a petite belch. She giggled, rubbing her waterbed of a stomach with big circular motions. Aryll curled up around the belly that was larger than she was. Swallowing her brother wasn’t easy, and she was tuckered out, ready for a good night’s sleep.

“Mm… Nighty-night, big brother,” Aryll smiled, drifting off into sleep…
12311.title: Ah, Sisterly Lo-*GULP*

123112.content:
Link’s eyes shot open and beheld total darkness. As he lacked vision, his other senses were left to pick up the slack. He felt his knees nestled against his face, his arms folded under his chest, and his back curved over. He was curled into a fetal position by some elastic material. Judging by the feeling of gravity, he was facing the ground, wherever he was. All he could hear were watery groans and bubbly pulsations. A particularly dense throbbing sound seemed to coincide with tremors in the stretchy walls. The more Link felt his surroundings slip and slide against his skin, the more he noticed that they seemed to be organic in nature. Link also noticed was that he was soaked and slickened by some viscous slop. It was pouring over him. It seeped into his underclothes. The sloshy juice saturated his hair in a way that reminded him of being swallowed by Molgera. The smell was not nearly as bad, though. “Well,” Link thought, wiggling his arms, barely able to move in the cramped space, “I think I’ve been eaten…”

A monstrous groan, unmistakably a gastrointestinal motion, seemed to confirm Link’s assumption. He didn’t feel as though his fleshy prison was swaying from his devourer’s movement. That, along with the muffled snoring Link heard somewhere above him, confirmed his eater was asleep. Apparently, whatever creature swallowed him thought he was little more than a treat to gulp down and effortlessly sleep off. That thought irked Link more than slightly. “Alright, monster. Get ready for a wakeup call.”

Link tightened up his legs, gathered strength, and threw a mighty kick at the muscled wall. Like rubber it stretched and tightened, constricting around his legs, slowly pulling back into its original shape. Link tried to keep his legs outstretched but the firm, fleshy walls were determined to smoosh him back into a ball. “Ugh, c’mon…” He spread his arms and tried to put the stubborn muscular network to the test by stretching it thin. The hero was lying with his arms and legs outspread in an X-shaped pose. He hoped he would wrestle the creature’s digestive system into some fatigue. Unfortunately, the slimy chamber was up to the challenge. The walls tightened around Link, causing his extended limbs to buckle. All around him the amorphous sack angrily contracted, determined to end his rebellion. Link shut his eyes and grit his teeth. This stomach had turned this into a test of his endurance instead. His strength was dropping. “Damn… Not sure if I can keep this up.”

Back outside, splayed out on Link’s bed basking in the moonlight was the slumbering form of Aryll. She was atop her oversized belly, her arms wrapped its circumference, her faze nuzzling the featureless peach blob. A smile passed over her open lips. Drool leaked from her mouth and ran down the side of her stomach. She was deep in a dream, which her brain was making far more pleasurable experience by incorporating the feeling of her gastrointestinal movements. “Mmuh,” she licked her lips, “Big brother you were so tasty…”

“Aryll!?” Though her voice was muffled through the intestinal fortitude and organic soundscape, Link knew the sound of his sister’s voice anywhere. The stomach walls suddenly closed in. Slimy muscles squeezed his body from every angle, forcing him into a tightly packed ball. “Grr… Let me out of here!” Link’s struggles saw an enormous rise in vigor. He punched, kicked, and thrashed in every direction, but the visceral sack seemed immovable. Link realized he needed a change in strategy. He began focusing on his hearing, seeking the source of the monster’s infernal heartbeat. Craning his head upward, he noted the intervals of each thump, eventually locating the heart somewhere above him. He wiggled and twisted, turning himself in the slippery stomach folds, repositioning where his back was facing downward. From the feeling of gravity Link was sure he was looking up. Timing his movement to avoid the kneading stomach walls, he curled up his knees. “Aryll! If you can hear me, just hold on!” Aiming his legs toward the monster’s vital organs, Link unleashed a powerful kick.

“…Mh? Big brother…?” Aryll awoke with a great yawn. “Where… Are- OW!!” The next feeling Aryll experienced was a stinging pain that exploded through her chest. She was shaken awake. Her bulbous belly trembled like a splash in a pond. “Big brother… Ouch… That hurt.” Link allowed his legs to recoil. He slid back into the moist pit in complete befuddlement. “Wh-wha? Aryll? Is… The monster hurting you?”

“W-what monster?”

“…Wait… No… Aryll.” Link’s jaw hung agape, allowing a drop of gastric fluid to splash onto his tongue. “You ate me. I’m inside you.”

“Um…” Aryll’s cheeks flushed a bright red. While swallowing Link her mind had wandered off to another place. She had actually intended to let him out, but she had ended up containing him completely inside her. And she had to admit, the feeling of her brother’s weighty body distending her rounded belly was rather nice. But she had never considered how he might react to being inside her stomach. “Aryll,” he said, “Uh… did you really swallow me?” The girl felt embarrassed, but she fought it. Telling Link the truth was more important. “Yes,” she admitted, “I-I gobbled you up, big brother...”

“What!? This has to be a dream,” he exclaimed, “Aryll, how is this possible? Am I shrunken?”

“No, not really… I just kinda swallowed you whole. I’m lying on top of you actually.”

“But that’s impossible! I’m bigger than you, how, did you do this?”

“I dunno… I just really wanted you to stay, big brother. I just wanted to have you forever, I guess. And…”

“…What?”

Aryll sheepishly smiled with ruby cheeks. “I was kinda hungry.”

“But Aryll, if you eat me, you’ll digest me.”

“So what?” Link tried to facepalm, but he couldn’t move his arm. “So I’ll die!”

Aryll gasped. Her eyes darted around the room, as if to find something to fish him out of her stomach. “Oh no! Big brother, I’m so sorry! I’ll get you out, I promise!” The engorged girl stuck her finger into her mouth, trying to stimulate a gag reflex. She hacked and heaved, her gut trying to squeeze its contents back up her throat. Her efforts were in vain, however, as Link’s heavy body refused to pass through the stiff sphincter. She tried again, coughing queasily, but nothing exited her belly. Aryll sniffled, a tear rolling down her cheek. “I’m sorry, big brother… Oh… What are we going to do?” Link sighed. “I’m not sure. But actually…” Link felt around the stomach walls, coating his hand in thicker gastric fluids. Aside from a warm, wet feeling, he didn’t seem to feel anything from the liquid. “I don’t think your stomach is digesting me at all. All the juices in here are just sliding off my back like nothing.” Aryll shivered with pleasure when she felt her brother massage her insides. She was no longer crying. “R-really?”

“Yeah.” Though Link didn’t verbally admit it, for fear of how Aryll would perceive it, being inside her stomach was actually quite relaxing. The smell was inoffensive, the humid air kept him cozy and warm, and the muscular contractions were like a combination of massaging and rocking. He wasn’t losing vitality. If anything, the environment was doing the opposite. It was almost womblike. Link was puzzled, but he had experienced plenty of weird things in his travels. “We’ll find a way to get me out of here, Aryll. But I’m not dying, so we can sleep and figure this out tomorrow.”

“Are you sure? I really don’t wanna hurt you.”

“Hey, I’ve been eaten by uglier monsters than you.”

Aryll giggled. “Okay, I trust you.”

The siblings went silent in their embrace, falling asleep…
123112.title: Aryll's Awakening

1231121.content:
Link was dreaming. He was on the beach at the water’s edge, just a quick walk away from his house. He was younger, lacking an adventurer’s experience. Seated firmly in the sand, he watched as the seawater washed over his bare feet. He curled his toes and shivered. The cool liquid sped away as soon as it had arrived, leaving his soaked feet chilled by the breeze. As a child he loved the feeling. He couldn’t comprehend what it was that was so pleasing about it at the time. Perhaps it was the sense of being at the edge of something as incomprehensibly large as the Great Sea. That sense that was followed by the call for adventure. Regardless of how developed his brain was, it was easy for Link to lose himself in the cold, watery embrace…

“Big broooootheeerr!”

…But it was difficult for him to stay there. Link’s head turned to his left. Aryll was on her knees, slapping uselessly at a mound of sand. At age four, she was somehow even cuter than her current self. Those big doe eyes were even bigger and doe-ier. Her dress was green, speckled with pink flowers. Her hair lacked pigtails, a messy pixie cut instead. “Help me finish this sand castle,” she pouted, “please?”

Link smiled and stood up. He went down onto his knee, by Aryll’s side, and grabbed handfuls of sand. He began hastily sculpting a rough approximation of Hyrule Castle. Link wasn’t much of an artist unless pictography was involved. The resulting lumpy mess was nothing to write home about. “Wow, big brother,” Aryll gasped, “That looks great!”

Link shrugged. “It’s nothing special.”

“No… It’s perfect as long as you made it!”

“Huh? How do you figure that, sis?”

Aryll turned toward Link and wrapped her arms around him. She buried her face in his chest. Link felt his heart throb against her tiny head. “Cuz… You made it for me! And you’ll always be there when I need you, right big brother?”

Link’s head tilted downward, his chin resting in Aryll’s hair. “…Of course I-“A torrent of water splashed against Link’s back. He turned, only to behold the sea rising, washing everything away, and utterly swallowing him within its waves…
_ _ _

Aryll’s eyelids twitched as morning sunshine flittered through the bedroom window. She reached up and yawned, trying to hop off the bed as she always did. Yet she seemed anchored to a heavy mass attached to her waist. She could not move. Her bulbous stomach, still full of her big brother, was her ‘bed.’ Aryll grunted and began rocking left and right, eventually rolling herself upright. She managed to seat herself on the side of the actual bed. Her belly hung between her legs, spilling out towards the floor in a cacophony of watery gurgles. “Ah,” she cutely yawned, “Good morning, big brother. Are you awake?”

She felt a small wriggling under her skin. “Yup,” Link replied, “let’s get going.”

“Uh… Get going?”

“To Tetra and the pirates. We’re going on a little trip.”

“To where?”

“Not sure yet. Thing is, the more I think about it, the more I think you managed to eat me with some kind of magic.”

Aryll’s eyes lit up. “Whoa! Am I a witch, big brother?”

“Um… Maybe. Even with the handful of spells I can cast I honestly don’t know much about magic. I’m still trying to think of an island where we’d find someone who does.”

“Huh. Wait, I just realized,” Aryll stopped and clutched her stomach with her hands, allowing her fingers to sink into her soft skin, “how am I gonna explain my big belly, big brother?”

“Well, just tell ‘em what happened.”

“Are you sure?”

“Yeah. They’ll get it. You were on their ship for a couple weeks, right?”

“Good point,” Aryll nodded, hopping off the bed. Somehow she managed to keep herself upright. “Wow,” she gasped, “I feel really strong, big brother! I’m holding you up….” She kneeled over onto her knees. “Ouff," she clutched her stomach and picked it up off the floor, "You’re still really heavy, though…”

“Sudden bursts of strength, huh? We’ve gotta get to the bottom of this. Can you walk?”

“Er… Yeah…” Aryll shakily got back on her feet.

The overstuffed girl waddled out into the main thoroughfare of the house. Grandma was sitting by the kitchen table sipping tea. She turned to see her granddaughter standing with a massive peach dome hanging from her waist, dangling past her knees. “Aryll…?”

“Um, good morning grandma.”

Grandma sat with her mouth agape. “I… forgot about how much you ate last night.”

“Yup… I, uh, was gonna go with the pirates… On a trip. Um… See ya!”

“Oh.” Grandma’s face suddenly became neutral. “Have a nice trip.”

Suddenly, a swift string of knocks clattered against the front door. “I’ll get it,” Aryll said, hurrying to the door and pulling it open. She was met with Tetra’s stern visage as she tried to walk inside, only to bump against Aryll’s stomach. “Wha- Aryll?” Tetra backed up and examined the chubby little girl. She playfully prodded at the fat gut. “Jeez, you’d make Jalhalla look anorexic. How the heck did you eat even more than last night?”

Aryll’s eyes rolled around the room. “Um…”

“Hey, no need to be embarrassed. I was just looking for Link.”

“Uh… About that.”

Aryll’s body suddenly emitted a muffled groan, which sounded to Tetra almost like a voice. She chuckled at the thought. “I’m in here, Tetra,” mumbled Link from behind the flabby rolls. Tetra cocked her head. “Huh? Link, this isn’t funny,” she began scanning the room behind Aryll, “Where are you really?”

Aryll blushed. “He’s not kidding, Tetra. I… Kind of ate him.”

Tetra’s eye twitched. “Oh.” She leaned forward and laid a hand on Aryll’s stomach. “You swallowed Link. He’s in your belly right now, huh?”

The stomach shuddered as Link readjusted himself. Tetra simply stood for a while. Aryll felt a chill run up her spine. Tetra began shaking, her eyes bulging. Then she shrieked. “WHAAAAAAAT? H-how! When? You- you’re just a kid! And how are you even standing? Your back must be killing you, right?”

Aryll reached behind herself. She patted her back muscles. “No, I feel fine! I’ve been feeling really strong today, actually.”

Tetra folded her arms and bit her lip. “…Ugh, this is just too weird. I’m still having trouble processing a person just eating another person whole. Can’t you spit him up, then?”

“I was just about to get to that,” Link said, “Aryll can’t throw me up, and I have to figure out what kind of magic is letting her do this.”

“And? How do you plan on getting that info?”

“Well, we’re gonna need a ship…”

Tetra sighed. Aryll smiled and giggled. “Whee! We really are going on a trip, right big brother?”

While waiting for preparations for the trip to be completed, Aryll relaxed on the deck of the house facing the infinite blue. She breathed in the salty air, kicking back in a folding chair, her belly resting on the cushions. Almost everyone on Outset Island heard about what happened. Many villagers visited her, fascinated by her oversized stomach. Upon seeing Aryll, Rose was concerned that her children, Joel and Zill, would try eating each other. The kids ended up being transfixed on Aryll’s belly, though. Joel and Zill approached her asking to be swallowed, which Aryll politely declined, claiming she was already full.

Aryll was helped aboard the pirate ship thanks to the combined efforts of Gonzo and Senza. Strong as she was, Aryll found difficulty ascending the slanted gangplank with Link’s weight throwing her off balance. The engorged girl was to bunk in Tetra’s quarters for the duration of the trip. Meanwhile, Tetra stood on the bridge of the ship to inform her crew of where they were headed.

“Alright guys,” Tetra announced, “Link told me where we need to go. Let’s plot a course for…”
1231121.title: Escape Plan

choices: Link Emerges, But He's a Little Shorter...
12311211.content:
Tetra’s bed was the most comfortable thing Aryll had ever rested on. She was splayed out on her side, her back supported by a row of pillows propped against the wall. Her stomach shared half the bed with her. Link benefited from the embrace of warm flesh and the softness of Tetra’s mattress. Aryll was directly facing Tetra’s desk and framed sea charts. Yet she couldn’t take her eyes off of the pictograph of Tetra’s mother. She looked so daring and imposing. Aryll wondered if Tetra would be like her when she grew older. She then asked Link a rather important question. “So why are we going to Dragon Roost Island, big brother?”

“Sis, don’t you remember Medli?”

Aryll scratched her head. “Oh yeah, the bird girl! Does she know magic?”

“She’s a sage, and she draws her power from an ancient sage’s spirit. She’ll have more magic knowledge than me. Plus she can manipulate a little magic with her harp.”

“Maybe she can help then! You’re so smart, big brother.”

“Aw… It’s no big deal.”

Aryll smiled, only for her countenance to quickly straighten. Swallowing Link had brought him closer to her heart than ever before. The sensation of Link moving around inside her felt amazing. She had even started rubbing her stomach habitually. But like any good feeling it was destined to end. Aryll recognized this fact and she was saddened by it. Swallowing Link was almost an accident, but the more she thought about it, the less she wanted to never let him leave her body… But, she thought, I’ve got to help my brother…
_ _ _

The journey to Dragon Roost Island took one full day. On the morning of the ship’s arrival Aryll walked out on deck, momentarily blinded by the rising sun. When her vision returned she beheld the towering silhouette of Dragon Roost, like a shadowy shark tooth shooting off into the heavens. The ship found a suitable port on the eastern side of the island. Aryll disembarked onto the beach with Tetra and the pirates as escorts. She entered the Rito village inside the mountain. The birdlike people were astonished as they beheld the fleshy orb hanging past the little girl’s knees. Eventually Medli appeared to greet them in the village’s central chamber, asking numerous questions about Aryll’s physical state. Aryll, Link, and Tetra offered conflicting accounts, but ultimately Medli reached her own conclusions.

“Okay,” Medli nodded, “I think I’m starting to get it. So, Link. You think your sister has some latent magical power?”

“Pretty much,” Aryll’s belly replied. Medli laughed. She felt like she was having a conversation with a girl’s digestive system. Such a bizarre thought…

“Aryll, Tetra, come with me to my quarters,” Medli offered.

“Huh,” Nico scratched his head, “what’re we gonna do?”

“Um…” Medli trembled nervously.

“Hey,” Tetra said, turning toward her crew, “You idiots like alcohol, right?”

“YEAAH!” the group heartily howled.

“Well…” She turned back toward Medli, “You guys got a watering hole, right?”

“Um, actually we do… It was built recently by merchants from Windfall, over by the eastern beach.”

Tetra shrugged. “Perfect. Nico! Gonzo! Crew!” The pirates in question stiffened up their posture. “Go get smashed while we deal with grown—up things, alright?”

The pirates cheered and stormed out of the village. Medli’s eyes widened. “I still can’t believe how loyal those men are.”

“Heh. There are only two things I can count on in this world- the wind behind my sails and the scumbags at my command.”

Link was surprised by Tetra’s word choice. “Scumbags?”

Aryll set a finger on her lip. “They can get kinda rowdy.”

Tetra nodded. “They’re scumbags, but they’re my scumbags… Heh.”

Medli turned and beckoned the two girls to follow. She led them down a rocky hallway to her personal quarters. The room was a modest circular chamber decorated with crimson and cerulean tapestries, bearing the marks of Din and Nayru respectively. A row of square windows offered a view of the boundless blue sky. A shining orange sphere, surrounded by Windfall couches, sat at the center of the room, supplying most of the illumination. “Hey, isn’t that Din’s Pearl?” Tetra asked. Medli nodded. “After the Tower of the Gods vanished the tribes responsible for watching over the pearls retrieved them from the Triangle Isles. The pearls are still powerful vestiges of magic, so I should be able to use Din’s Pearl to detect whatever magic is currently coursing through Aryll.”

Aryll took a seat on a couch in front of the pearl. Her belly hung between her thighs and brushed on the floor, glowing orange from Din’s burning light. Tetra sat on another couch across from Aryll. Medli kneeled between Aryll and the pearl, laying one hand on the fleshy sphere and the other on the orange one. Aryll shivered a little as the Rito girl’s cold hand made contact with her stomach. “Stay calm, Aryll,” Medli said, “I’m going to start scanning the magical energies… Er… I think that’s right. Sorry, I’m still new to this, even as a sage.”

“Take your time,” Link said.

Medli certainly did. It took her nearly four minutes, but Aryll’s hand suddenly began to glow. It was a golden glow, in the shape of a triangle. All three girls gasped. Tetra stood up. She stared at the girl’s hand. “Aryll… Is that a…”

Medli was entranced as well. “A Triforce piece…?”

“What!?” Link seemed to be in the greatest disbelief despite his face being invisible. “There’s no way! I’ve got Courage, Tetra’s got Wisdom, so that only leaves-“

Suddenly, Aryll hacked and hiccupped. Medli retracted her hand. Aryll stood up, her stomach writhing and condensing. A storm of groans and gurgles began brewing in the squirming organic sac. “I think we’re getting a reaction,” Medli yelled.

Aryll frowned and belched. “Oooh… My belly feels all queasy…” Her bubbling belly heaved and squeezed its contents back up her gullet, forming a massive bulge in her throat. She opened her maw wide, allowing Link to escape. Aryll’s eyes shut. She winced in pain as her brother’s head stretched her esophageal muscles on its way back up through her neck…
12311211.title: Medli's Magic

123112112.content:
Aryll lurched forward. Her once-bloated stomach was rapidly shrinking, nearly its original shape, and her dress was settling back over her knees. Her mouth gaping open, her legs spread apart, she expelled something dense and slimy. It fell onto her lap and landed with a weighty plop. It then rolled off her thigh and fell between her knees. She coughed and sputtered, her eyes tearing up a little. She shut her eyes tightly and laid a hand on her groaning stomach. “Ooh… My poor tummy… Hey!” Aryll’s eyes shot open as she beheld her lack of a Link-sized belly. “I’m back to normal!” She looked at Tetra, who sat with a startled face, then at Medli, who was kneeling on the floor with a similar expression. Aryll was confused. “What’s wrong, girls?”

Tetra sighed. “I don’t know, that was just a little intense I guess.”

Medli shook her head, regaining her senses. “I suppose it’s good that your stomach has returned to its normal size,” the Rito girl said, “But I still have one concern…”

“Hm? What is it, Medli?”

“…Where is Link?”

Aryll felt a chill run down her spine. Her eyes frantically darted around the room for any sign of her brother. “Big brother! Where are you!?” She stood up and turned around to check behind the couch. There was still no sign of him. She turned back around and started hurrying toward the other side of the room. As she passed by Tetra, the pirate girl reached out and grabbed her shoulder.

“Aryll, hold up…” Tetra pointed toward the lower rim of Aryll’s skirt. “Um… Don’t freak out, but I think I found Link.”

Aryll cocked her head. “Huh?” She followed Tetra’s gaze toward her skirt and caught the slightest hint of a silhouette of something hanging off the fabric. Medli appeared at Aryll’s side, examining the object. The blue-skirted girl backed up and sat back down. Medli and Tetra followed her, standing before her, closely studying the object. Aryll then lowered her head to get a better view. Whatever it was, it was clinging tightly to her skirt. The longer Aryll looked the more humanoid the shape seemed to look. The clinging seemed to be accomplished by a pair of hands reaching from its body. Between the hands was what looked like a head, with short, blonde hair growing out of its scalp. In fact, that particular shade of blonde actually reminded Aryll of her own hair color…

“Wait a sec,” Aryll said, “Could that be…?”

“But that’s impossible,” Medli whispered, “he couldn’t have… Shrunken?”

Aryll reached down and picked the object off her dress. She pinched it between her thumb and pointer finger brought it before her face and confirmed her suspicion. It was Link! Somehow he had been shrunken, somewhere around three centimeter’s in height, held by his bare waist. He was still wearing only his underclothes. His legs kicked uselessly at the air. His tiny eyes were locked onto her pond-sized pupils. Aryll gasped. “Big brother…?”

Tetra kneeled and closely examined the shrunken hero. “Well, I guess he isn’t your ‘big’ brother anymore…”

Medli planted her knees on the floor and joined Aryll. “This must be a result of the magic reaction… Er, sorry, Link.”

Link was still a little overwhelmed. Aryll’s face loomed before him like a sheer cliff. Glancing behind himself to his left and right, he saw Tetra and Medli’s gigantic visages as silhouettes in Din’s light. He was surrounded by giantesses, a fantasy that his thirteen-year-old mind had occasionally concocted. Yet to be thrust into this situation with his sister and two of his friends was a little much. He felt frozen.

“Oh no,” Medli whimpered, “I think he’s scared… Aw… Poor little guy.”

Aryll gasped. “Big brother, please don’t be afraid! I’m not gonna hurt you!”
Link blushed and shook himself out of his shock He was mature for his age but he still felt a little patronized by the girls’ tone. “I’m fine, Medli,” he looked back toward Aryll and nodded, “at least I’m back outside, huh?”

“Yeah,” Aryll replied, “I’m just happy you’re okay, big brother.”

Link shuddered as he felt Tetra’s fingers clench around his waist. “Whoa!”

Tetra rolled her eyes, then brought Link’s minute form closer to them. “Aw, gimme a break. I just wanted a closer look at you. Hm… You know, if you were to stay this way, you’d make a pretty handy thief.”

“But I don’t wanna stay this way! Medli, do you have any idea how to undo this?”

“Um…” The Rito girl’s eyes fell to the floor. “I’m sorry, Link, I don’t know if I can. I’m no expert on the Triforce of Power.”

“Now hold on,” Tetra said, “we don’t know if she really…” Aryll’s open fingers moved in to take Link back. Tetra saw the back of the girl’s hand and beheld the unmistakable golden triangle glowing atop her skin. After Aryll seized Link, Tetra told her to look at her hand.

“Huh?” Aryll obeyed and turned the back of her hand toward her face. “Wow,” Aryll exchanged Link with her other hand. She looked at the amber mark, transfixed by its three-pointed shape. “My hand is glowing! See, big brother?”

Link watched as the Triforce mark on back of Aryll’s hand turned toward him. He could not believe the energy that had once fueled his arch nemesis now inhabited his young sister. “Aryll,” Tetra said, “This is pretty serious. The Triforce of Power can do some real damage if you don’t keep it under control.”

Link nodded, though Aryll could hardly see it. “Tetra’s right, sis. We’re gonna have to deal with this somehow…”

“Um, Link,” Medli chimed in, “maybe Ganondorf left some information on the Triforce of Power at Forsaken Fortress? A book, perhaps?”

Tetra crossed her arms. “That’s assuming your dragon didn’t barbeque his whole library.”

Medli cupped her hand around her chin. “Lord Valoo certainly did some damage.”

“Yeah,” Link agreed, “but that really is all we have to go on. Can we leave tomorrow, Tetra?”

“Sure thing.”

“But where are we gonna sleep?” Aryll asked.

“Hm.” Link had to admit, that was a good question.

Tetra shrugged. “The crew & I can sleep in the ship.”

Aryll looked to her shrunken sibling. Despite the obvious size difference, she still looked to him for guidance. “What about us, big brother?”

Link gave it some thought, and decided…
123112112.title: Link Shrinks

1231121121.content:
Standing up in Aryll’s flattened hand, Link looked at each of the three gigantic girls watching over him. “I mean, I wouldn’t want to be around a bunch of drunken pirates when I’m in this state.”

Tetra smiled and nervously scratched her head. “Getting them wasted was kind of a short-term solution.”

“Miss Medli,” Aryll began, “Would you be okay if we stayed in here?”

The Rito girl nodded. “Of course, Aryll. You three have been my friends for a while now. You can all stay the night here if you’d like.”

“Nah,” Tetra turned to leave the room, “I gotta wrangle some pirates. And it’s easier for me to keep them from breaking things when I’m watching them, y’know?”

Medli nodded again. “It was nice seeing you, Tetra. Would you mind if I walked with you? I wanted to discuss a few things, actually.”

“Not at all,” Tetra said, offered a single wave to Link and Tetra as she and Medli left through the door. Aryll sat down on the couch and placed Link on a knee-high table off to the couch’s side. She reclined and yawned. “Mm, the last few days have been pretty crazy, huh brother?”

“What,” Link chuckled, looking up at his mountainous sister’s head, “with you eating me, us heading back to Dragon Roost, you puking me up, and me shrinking? Nah. Weird stuff like this is business as usual for us.”

“Hehehe, I guess you’re right, big brother.”

Link sat cross-legged on the table. “You know, we never really talked about your time in captivity. Was it scary?”

Aryll took a deep breath. “It felt like it lasted for months. I wasn’t sure if I would ever see you again. But when you came to save me that one night, it filled me so much hope. Even though you failed, just knowing that you were out there, that you were fighting to rescue me… It made it a lot less scary.”

“You believed in me that much?”

“Of course I did! You’ve always been more than my brother. Link…” Aryll blushed. His name was a sacred thing, something that could seldom be spoken. “You’ve always been my hero.”

Link smiled. His lips trembled as tears welled up behind his eyes. He lifted a hand and wiped the salty droplets from his brow. “T-thanks, Aryll. I never knew I meant that much to you.”

Aryll hunched over, looking more closely at Link. “Are you… Crying, big brother?”

“Wha- no! I just- it’s nothing!’

The young giantess giggled. “It’s okay! You can cry, like that time you got your toe pinched by that crab!”

“Are you kidding? That’s not how it happened! First of all…” Nearly an hour of conversation passed between the two siblings. As the day faded into night Aryll curled up with a blanket on the couch. Wistfully gazing at the sun and clouds through the room’s lone window, the girl descended into slumber the moment the orange orb vanished under the horizon. Link rested on a clump of handkerchiefs that Aryll had arranged atop the small table, incidentally behind her feet. Her ankles were propped on the end of the couch and he could see her soles and toes dangling off the arm. Her big toe was now larger than his head. Link turned from Aryll’s wrinkled soles to face the door. To his surprise, the door creaked open, and in stepped Medli, her eyes half-open, lazily scanning the room. A goofy grin was splayed across her face.

“Medli,” Link called up to her, “you okay?”

“Wha- what’s that,” Medli stumbled forth, “Someone… Calling… Me?”

Link stood up and walked toward the edge of the table. There was something off with the way she was walking and talking. “Medli, I’m down here on the table.”

“Ta-ble…” Her gaze drifted down toward him. Her pupils almost exploded when she spotted the shrunken hero. “Whoa! You’re so tiny…” She reached down and awkwardly groped the air around Link. He ended up stepping between her open fingers to help her, and they closed into a fist around him. With only his head exposed, Link tried to free his arms from Medli’s iron grip, but he could not budge. She brought him before her pond-sized eyes and gasped. “You really are just a tiny little thing…! Wow…”

Link felt Medli’s hot breath waft up from her mouth. He sniffed at the air and caught a stale grape-like scent. “Wait a minute,” Link exclaimed, “Medli, are you drunk!?”

Medli lowered Link in front of her chin. She laid a finger on her chin and pondred her present state of existence. “Hm…. Uh… Hurk…” A low gurgling moan sounded somewhere inside Medli’s body. Then the Rito girl’s mouth opened and released a raucous belch. Link recoiled as the smell of alcohol blasted past his face. “Eheheh,” she licked her upper lip, “Yeah… Tetra, she uh… She is such a nice girl… Y’know?...”

“Medli,” Link looked up toward her eyes. She was staring off into space. “C’mon, focus!”

“What…” Medli’s eyes fell back toward the little hero in her hand. The girl grinned.

Link’s face came to hold an expression of abject terror.

“Y’know,” she said, “You kinda look like…”
1231121121.title: A Night at Medli's

choices: Link Rests Comfortably in the Stomach
12311211212.content:
“You look just like what my momma would feed me when I was a baby… Eheheheheh…”

“Medli,” Link commanded with a deathly serious tone, “You have to focus. It’s me, Link. You helped me save the world, remember?” Medli ignored Link and hoisted him upside-down over her head. His face dangled over hers. She looked up at him and licked her lips. Her belly growled in anticipation. “Medli,” he screamed, “please don’t eat me!”

Medli arched an eyebrow. “Hey, quit talking… Worms don’t talk…” The boy in her grip began frantically struggling. She tightened her grip and giggled. “Aw, you’re a squirmy little guy! Just like the worms I used to have for breakfast! You’re gonna feel soooo good wriggling on your way down…” Her jaws began creaked apart, giving Link a front-row preview of his destination. Ropes of saliva linking her teeth snapped as her maw opened fully. A slobbery bubble rolled back over her undulating tongue and burst as it brushed against her uvula. Shiny orange reflections of torchlight and Din's Fire danced around her cheeks. But no light met the black void beyond the tongue. The fleshy outcropping around the girl’s gullet contracted, sucking a thick flow of spit down the slippery tube.

The Rito girl winked. “Down the hatch, little wormy~”

Medli shut her eyes and let Link go. He plummeted past her beak and plopped onto her salivating tongue. The slimy, almost frictionless surface was angled upward, so Link immediately began sliding headfirst toward the back of Medli’s mouth. He flipped horizontally and grabbed a tooth with both hands, somehow managing to slow his descent. Link now hung over the steamy pit, taste buds sampling his face. “Gr, I’m not gonna end up as birdseed,” Link groaned, barely able to keep his grip. “Too bad I can’t use the Command Melody…” Suddenly Medli flicked her tongue, sending her treat sailing toward her gullet. The boy flew through the humid air and felt a sudden stop, followed by a firm fleshy grip on his waist. Half of Link’s body was stuck in the tight ring of muscle serving as the gateway into the Rito girl’s digestive system. He tried pushing himself back out but he only slid in further. His legs fluttered pathetically outside the throat. Back outside, Medli laid a finger on her neck and swallowed.

*gluck*

Medli sighed. She felt a squirmy lump throb against her finger and disappear beyond her collarbone. Her tongue slid over her lips. “Mmmm…” Link kicked wildly against the dense viscera inside her chest. His frenetic struggles felt immaculate. Medli waddled over toward her bed. She shivered in pleasure as she felt Link plop into her stomach. Falling back into the bed, the Rito girl viciously rubbed her gurgling belly. “Such a tasty worm…”

“Medli, you idiot…” Link grumbled in the steamy darkness, lying flat on the wrinkled floor. Half his head was under in a puddle of gastric juices and alcohol. He stood up on his knees and wiped the thick liquid off his face. Sweltering air circulated Medli’s stomach. It carried a faint, acrid odor, overridden by the fruity scent of whatever the girl was currently drunk on. The intense heat made Link glad that he was clad in only his nightclothes from two nights before. He pulled his shirt off and tossed it aside. He backed away from the acidic pit and sat on the undulating floor, on the spot where it curved into the pulsating wall. “Can’t believe I’ve been eaten by two girls in a row… I guess it was only a matter of time at this size.” Link laid his hand into the slimy wall and grabbed a handful of viscous liquid. He closed his fist and felt the goop slip between his fingers. “Hm, it doesn’t feel like I’m being digested. I wonder if the Triforce of Courage is protecting me… Or maybe Rito stomachs aren’t strong enough to process a Hylian.”

As if to challenge Link’s claim Medli’s gastrointestinal system roared to life. Liquid poured in from all sides as the muscular walls harshly contracted. Link yelped as his fleshy seat ejected him. “Oh, come on!” The shrunken hero was shoved into a whirlpool of gastric juices. The waves sloshed him all around the organic chamber during its vicious effort to digest him. “Medli!!” Despite Link’s present frustration with her, Medli was lying contently on her bed, massaging her bubbling belly. One last burp slithered up her throat as she drifted off into slumber, oblivious to the raging maelstrom inside her body and Link’s struggles to stay afloat in it. Before long she was snoring alongside Aryll, and by morning everyone would be blissfully unaware of the boy’s predicament.

Thankfully for Link the waters soon calmed and he washed up on the fleshy shore. Rather than attempt to stand, he turned over and laid back. “I don’t know if my movement prompted that craziness, but I’m just gonna play it safe. Hm… Hopefully I can rest in here…” Link figured that on the next morning everyone would wonder where he was. He would wiggle a little against Medli’s stomach folds when he heard her speak. A simple but solid plan.
12311211212.title: Bird Food

choices: Let's Stop By Somewhere Else First
123112112121.content:
“…Med…”

“…Mm…” Medli tossed and turned in bed.

“…edli! Wake up!”

The Rito sage felt her arm being jerked. Her eyelids fluttered, and she saw Aryll’s face bathed in the pink dawn’s light. Then her eyes squeezed shut. “Mmf… My head hurts…”

“C’mon, Ms. Hangover,” Tetra’s annoyed voice barked, followed by a light flick against Medli’s forehead, “We’re looking for Link. He’s gone missing.”

“What!?” Medli exclaimed, scrabbling out of her bed. As soon as she stood up she clutched her stomach and hunched over. “Ooh… My tummy hurts... What did I do last night?”

Tetra sighed. “I’m sorry. It wasn’t really your fault. We went aboard the deck my ship to hang out, but unfortunately my crew was having a wild party. You were drinking a glass of water, and unfortunately Niko was a little tipsy so he mistook it for his grape wine. So the drinks got mixed up. You wouldn’t think grape wine would have much of a kick, but… Yeah. My crew can get ahold of some weird stuff, combined with you being a bit of a lightweight. No offense. Anyway, I walked you back to your room, but I had to hurry back to supervise them.”

Medli rubbed her temple. “I can’t remember anything, and now you’re saying Link is missing. I probably didn’t notice he was gone when I came back.”

“It’s okay, Medli,” Aryll said with a reassuring pat on the shoulder, “We can look for him together.”

The two girls nodded and looked to Tetra, who shrugged. “I guess we should inform the rest of your tribe, eh Medli?”

“Yes,” Medli agreed, “I’ll go and find- huh?”

Aryll cocked her head. “What’s wrong, Medli?”

Medli felt around her abdomen. “I feel something inside my stomach. It’s… Moving around, I think.”

Tetra gasped. “Wait, you don’t think…”

Aryll’s face was drained of color. “L-Link?”

“Um… It’s still moving- ack!” Medli gasped as Aryll sped over toward her, laying an ear on her abdomen. “Big brother,” she shouted, “C-can you hear me in there?”

Thankfully, behind the dense network of gastrointestinal tissue, Link heard his sister loud and clear. “I’m fine, Medli! Just let Medli know she’s gonna have to get me out of here somehow, and I think both of us would rather have me leave the way I came in!”

“Okay, big brother! Hang in there for just a second!” Aryll stood back up. Medli was exceedingly pale. She covered her eyes, on the verge of tears. “Oh, gods… I… I ate Link… I’m such a moron!”

Tetra groaned. “Oh, suck it up! Link’s been through worse. Heck, this isn’t even the first time this has happened to him, remember?” Medli shakily nodded. “J-just give me a brief moment,” the Rito girl said, maneuvering over toward the couch and taking a seat. She tilted her head down and cupped her hands under her mouth. After a harsh round of coughing and sputtering, a glob of bodily liquid plopped into her palms, carrying Link inside. Medli sighed as the minute body twitched weakly. She stood up and brought him to a water basin near the doorway, dipping him inside to cleanse him. As soon as he seemed to have fully recovered, Medli began her apology train.

“Link, I’m so, so sorry. Truly, I am. I will suffer any penance that will equalize us.”

Link sighed. “Medli, it’s... It’s fine.”

Medli’s eyes widened. “No, it’s not! I swallowed you whole! I can’t imagine how unpleasant that would be!”

“It sucked, that’s for sure. But you don’t need to worry about it.”

“Link, I…!”

“Alright, you know what? Bring me close to your cheek.” Medli frowned, but then relented and obeyed. Link delivered a quick punch to the giantess’s face. Despite the strike’s weakness she gasped when she felt it. “Huh? What was that, Link?”

“Your punishment. There, you’re punished.”

“What- Link!”

Tetra sauntered over with a smirk. “Hey, if you’re in such a hurry to get punched, I can oblige you.”

“Tetra! Th-that’s not what I meant!” Aryll walked after Tetra and giggled at her comment. She reached for Link. Medli reluctantly offered him. She sighed. “I think I’m okay… As long as Link’s safe I feel fine. But…” The Rito girl reeled Link back in. “Aryll, would you mind if Link & I… talked for a minute? Alone?”

Aryll winked and smiled. “Sure, as long as you don’t eat him again!”

Medli laughed nervously. “Thank you, girls.” Aryll and Tetra left the room.

Medli sat down on the couch and set Link on her thigh. She folded her hands. She took a very, very deep breath and exhaled. “Link, I just wanted to clear something up. When we journeyed into the Earth Temple, we worked together. We protected each other. We conquered that place together. I guess what I’m trying to say is… when I fought alongside you, I felt really good. When I was by your side, I felt safe, and I…”

“Medli.”

A tear rolled down her cheek. She looked down at the shrunken boy, who peered up at her like a knight in a courtyard. She stood on a balcony, watching his every movement. “Link…”

Link sighed. “You know we’re going outside the charted waters, right?”

She nodded, choking back a storm of bawling. “I-I know, but…”

Link clenched his fist. His lip trembled. “I’m sorry.”

“I-I understand. But… Link?”

“Yeah?”

“…I hope this doesn’t sound selfish, but… Please don’t forget about me.”

Link reached toward her face. Medli offered her open palm. They touched for a moment, then split. “I won’t, Medli. Honestly, the times I spent with you were awesome. I won’t forget you.”

Medli breathed for several seconds. “Thank you.”

The pair sat in silence for a while.
_ _ _

On Dragon Roost beach, Medli handed Link to Aryll. The two waved to each other as Medli walked away. Aryll and Link turned toward the pirate ship, where Tetra waited, peering over the starboard railing.

“Well,” Tetra said, “now that we’re all back together, are we ready to go to Forsaken Fortress?”

Link thought about it for a moment…
123112112121.title: Up & Out of 'Em

choices: She Was Towering Over the Trees
She Was Standing Right Behind Him
1231121121211.content:
Aryll and Link sat on together the couch in Tetra’s quarters. Aryll, clad in her maroon skull dress, crossed her arms behind her head as she listened to her brother’s tales of his numerous Great Sea exploits. The tiny hero was clad in nothing but his undershorts, perched on his sister’s thigh as he related his exploits. “Ice Ring Isle was the coldest place I’d ever been. I had no idea how I would get in, and then I ran into a cyclone on the sea. It seemed like bad luck, but it turned out that the storm had been caused by one of the wind gods, Cyclos. He gave me the power to travel using cyclones, which helped me to reach the inside of the Mother & Child Isles. That was where…” Link interrupted himself when he and Aryll heard a rumble of thunder. “Huh, that’s funny. I was talking about storms just now.”

Tetra barged through the door, panting heavily. “Guys,” she shouted between gaps of breath, “We’re- heading- toward a- big- cyclone!”

Aryll gasped. “No way! Link was just telling me about how he could control cyclones!”

“That’s why I came down here. Shrunken or not you should still have some influence over that wind deity, Link.”

The hero grumbled. “I’ll try to talk to him, but I’ve got a bad feeling about this…”

Aryll, Link, and Tetra assembled with the pirates on the deck. The ship’s prow was aimed at the dead center of the gigantic gray wind column. The smell of vapor mixed with seawater tickled their nostrils as cool, moist air whipped through their hair. Link, fearing for his sister’s safety, told her to hand him over to Tetra. Aryll obliged and told him to be careful. As Tetra reached the bow she held the tiny hero above her head like a divine offering. “Hey, your name is Cyclos, right? Check it out- I’ve got the Hero of Winds right here! Now knock it off and end this storm!”

Standing on Tetra’s hand-platform, Link tried to remember the Ballad of Gales. Without the Wind Waker he would have to use his hands to conduct. Down … Right… Left…. Up. For a moment, nothing happened. Then Link felt the winds beneath his body grow stronger. He was pushed to the edge of the hand. “Uh… Tetra?”

“What is it Li- EEK!” The shrunken, weightless hero hovered up above Tetra’s hand. She tried to grab him but he simply drifted away. Link flew away, hurtling toward the cyclone. Aryll dashed to the mast, shoving Tetra aside. “Big brother!!!!”
_ _ _

Link woke up in a warm, mysterious forest. He pushed himself to his feet, his head on a swivel as he took in the shadowy outlines of twisted trees. Looking upward he saw the dark violet sky broken up by twinkling stars. It seemed to be night, yet the color of the sky seemed off somehow. Judging by his size relative to the trees he seemed to be back at his normal height. This realization relieved him, but his comfort was interrupted when he heard a rustle. In the darkened woods sparks of red, cyan, green, and pink suddenly appeared, illuminating nearby trees. Fireflies danced between the branches and leaves like a rainbow of flashing spheres. Wind rustled the trees and sent a stream of crystalline grass and leaves past Link. He turned and saw the gust, its shining contents reflecting a trailing swarm of fireflies, hurrying off into the forest. The glittery mass revealed a pathway to Link. Wearing nothing but his underwear and lacking options, he followed the wind into the woods.

He was led to a grassy clearing with a large circular pond. The cyan waters glowed and rippled as a small geyser gushed at the center. Link recognized the spot. It was the interior of the Mother & Child Isle, where he had received fire and ice arrows. Or at least he thought it was- the pond he remembered was surrounded by rock but this one was in a forest. Otherwise it was identical. Link approached the water, feeling warmth radiate from it. The water was naturally heated, just like on the Isle. He dipped a foot in, feeling refreshed after walking through the woods nearly naked. Link took a seat and let his ankles slide beneath the water. He almost felt like he could drift away and sleep…

Then he heard a familiar giggle. It whisked through the trees like a wind chime. “The Fairy Queen…?” Link turned around and saw that…
1231121121211.title: Yes

choices: Link catches the Fairy Queen’s head between his jaws
She vanishes- it was just an illusion
12311211212112.content:
Link beheld the Fairy Queen in all her luminosity. Her silvery cyan skin shined against the ethereal darkness. Her big blank eyes were locked onto his pupils. Her short bob of hair swayed ever so slightly in the wind. A smile curled around her lips. “We meet again, little boy! How have you been?”

“Um… I’ve been okay.” Link had trouble making any coherent thoughts. The last thing he had expected was for the Fairy Queen to appear again, standing right behind him. Well, not standing per se. She was floating over the ground. Her flowing gown came down to her ankles. She giggled in that twinkling succession of cries that only a fairy could emit. Link’s lips were straight. “Uh… Thanks for returning me to normal.”

“Mm? Normal… Oh, you think I restored you to your true size. I’m afraid not. You see, in the fairy realm physical proportions are rather different from how they are in the mortal realm. In fact,” she pointed at herself, “this body is just an astral projection, another one of my puppets. I hope you’re happy that I chose a form you were familiar with!”

Link hung his head low. “I was really hoping I was back to normal.”

“Yes, I’m afraid the Triforce of Power’s curses are beyond my ability to dispel.”

“So, why’d you bring me here,” Link asked, “Did you control that cyclone?”

“Cyclos brought you here,” the smiling Queen’s reply electrified the air, “but it was a favor for me. Now…” She giggled again as she watched Link stand up and turn to her. “I brought you here so we could play a game of hide-n-go-eat!”

A worried frown formed on Link’s face. “Why do I have a bad feeling about that name?”

“Hehehe! Because, you guessed it- the winner gets to eat the loser!”

Link shook his head. “After all the eating that’s been going on I should’ve known that would be the catch…”

“Yes, that is the catch, but if you manage to win… Let’s just say I’ll let you in on a little Triforce secret. So will you play with me, little boy?” Link considered her offer. On one hand, he didn’t know what kind of magic she would use to mess with him. For all he knew she would just teleport him into her stomach. On the other hand, if he won he might get some juicy info. Speaking of juicy… Link was starting to get curious of sweet a fairy girl would taste. Saliva pooled beneath his tongue. He clenched his fist. “Alright. You’re on!”

The Queen laughed. “I’ll hide first! Come & find me if you can!” Her body was engulfed in a bright rainbow of energy before disappearing into the warm air. The cloud of energy seemed to float toward the forest. Link followed it, descending back into the bioluminescent glow. He noticed that the light from the trees and roots was colored a subtle green when earlier it had been mostly blue. As he stalked between the trees in search of the Fairy Queen he began to have second thoughts. Finding anyone in this surreal network of dense, motley flora would be a challenge. Finding the fairy deity who held domain over it would be impossible depending on her mood. Of course, if she sent a projection of herself then that probably meant she was willing to be caught. Or maybe that was how she appeared to everyone, lest she disintegrate them by the sheer energy of her presence. At any rate this was just a game to her. And if she was playing a game, she had the potential to lose.

Crouching in a thick wall of foliage, Link was shrouded from sight. Looking across a pathway he was able to see the Queen seated next to a stream, beneath the swaying vines of a willow. She was cupping her hands together and slurping up handfuls of water. Link wondered if he could sneak across the median and successfully stuff her head into her mouth. Link had not seen how his sister managed to eat him but he assumed it was as simple as opening his mouth so wide that it exceeded its normal limits. He had no time to test his theory, though. He had to act immediately. Link stepped out of the bush and advanced silently.

Link came to a stop as he stood a foot from the Fairy Queen’s back. He shut his eyes. I guess it’s now or never, he thought, his jaw unhinging past his collarbone as he lunged forth…
12311211212112.title: Fairy Queen's Game

choices: She thinks of a… different way
123112112121122.content:
Link’s jaws clamped over air. He slowly opened his eyes and saw only the shimmering waters that the Queen had been seated in front of. Huh!? “Ehehehe,” the Fairy Queen’s voice whistled through the trees like the night breeze, “you didn’t think it would be that easy, did you?” Link staggered backward, rotating and scanning his surroundings in search of the Queen’s taunting. The bioluminescent roots in the trees began to flash and change from green to white. The energy-filled veins then shifted to a glittering cyan. “It’s my turn now! Hehehe… You’d better hide, little boy! I’m quite famished!”

Link groaned. “It was all a trick. Now what am I gonna do?” The hero’s answer, for the moment, was to walk back into the woods and try to find a place to hide. The specifics did not matter as long as he was hidden. Link knew that if she wasn’t playing fair then he would already be swilling in her stomach. Or perhaps it was all for her amusement, who could say? Link spotted a massive hollow log, big enough to house at least eight people. It sat dead ahead of his position, at the end of a corridor of trees. The branches hung over the pathway, casting blurred shadows over the dirt. Link began his trek toward the log. “It’s better than nothing,” he figured, halfway to his destination, “I just hope she doesn’t- OUFF!”

Something heavy and covered in cloth slammed into Link’s bare back. The hero tumbled over, the object pinning him to the ground. He pulled his face out of the dirt and turned to see a familiar pair of cyan eyes underlined by a mischievous smile. The Fairy Queen’s delicate rear end weighed him down like a pair of squishy cannonballs. “Found you!" she squeaked. Link let his head fall back into the dirt. I can’t believe how easily I was caught. He felt her elegant fingernails drum against his scalp. “Aw, chin up, little boy! I promise the inside of my body is just as beautiful as the outside!” The Queen hopped off Link’s back and waved her hand in his direction. He hovered off the ground, positioned upright, floating surrounded by glowing blue energy. The Queen and Link locked eyes as she giddily rubbed her hands together. Her impatient stomach gurgled in anticipation. Link winced a little. “Oh, this is so exciting! But, how to enjoy my snack…”
123112112121122.title: Queen Takes Knight

1231121121211221.content:
The Fairy Queen stuck her fingertip between her lips. She pondered for a moment. Then her eyes lit up and her finger emerged, a rope of saliva clinging to her nail, and tapped her chin. She smiled. “Well, I suppose there’s nothing wrong with going down the ‘ol hatch, huh? Hehehe!” Link could barely move in the Queen’s magical restraints, but she gave him enough leeway to cross his arms and pout. The Queen’s smile faded a little. “Awww… What’s the matter? It’ll be like a waterslide! And when you splash into the juices… Mm. I’ll keep my belly nice and warm for you, little boy.” Link felt himself hovering higher up. The Queen gestured downward and he suddenly flipped upside-down. Link saw the Queen’s piercing cyan-green gaze, surrounded by the grass and trees sharing the same colors, seemingly looming above him. The fairy offered one last giggle. All the leaves and bushes seemed to dance with each syllable. “Hehehehe… Remember to squirm a little for me, okay? I love eating things that fight back!”

But you don’t even have to ea-Link cut his thought short as the Fairy Queen’s lips parted, revealing a gooey, turquoise cavern within. Her mouth, stretching and dilating in all directions, still assumed a smile throughout its transformation. Half the Queen’s body was obscured by a crescent-shaped gateway into her slimy, shimmering innards. The inside of her mouth looked like an abyssal pit hiding a sky blue bonfire. Link’s floating body was positioned at just the right angle to slide right inside. The Fairy Queen took advantage of this as she snapped her fingers, conveying the boy’s body into her gaping maw. Her warm breath washed over him and he found himself breathing it all in. It smelled of roses and fresh soil. Link’s nose wrinkled at the pleasant scent while his eyes adjusted to the alien lights inside the Fairy Queen’s mouth. The flashing bioluminescent veins in her cheeks and at the back of her throat dazzled the young hero. His vision refocused just in time to catch a glimpse of her uvula above dangling the contracting muscular ring. As his head found its way past the gums, the Queen’s tongue, like a serpent lying in wait, sprung to life and frenetically slathered his face and shoulders.

“Mmmh,” the Queen moaned, her echoing voice seemingly rising from the forest itself, “You’re quite a mouthful, and such a delectable taste! But all good things must end… Bottoms up!” The hero felt the magic gripping his sides vanish. Link saw the veins framing the mouth interior suddenly become streaks of light as he plummeted headfirst into the Fairy Queen’s gullet. Rippling esophageal muscles caught him and slowed his descent, softly kneading his face and chest. Hot, humid air wafted all around him. He snorted out some gastric fluid he had caught in his nose.
