He felt his legs still kicking on the outside. The Queen’s lips suckled on his hips, firmly sealed over his skin. Link wondered if he could squirm his way back up. Then a watery sound swelled around him as glowing turquoise liquid gushed down the fleshy tube. “GULP!” The powerful throat muscles contracted, violently squeezing his chest deeper inside.

“Mm-mm,” Link heard the Queen’s youthful voice chime around him in a sing-song tone, melodically punctuated by the beat of her heart, “Just squirm a-little, squirm a-little… It’s no fun when ya don’t struggle and wriggle! GUULP!” Link’s body plummeted deeper into the throat, closer to the ominous glowing pit that gurgled away below. He could see the faint rays of light from the luminous digestive juices peeking between the puffy throat muscles. Only his knees and ankles remained outside now. Panicked and claustrophobic, Link bent forward in the constraining flesh tunnel and thrashed, punched, and shoved against the Queen’s exotic digestive system.

“Ohhh-!” the Queen lovingly patted the undulating bulge in her distended chest, “The struggles of a hero, fighting it out in his last moments…! But I’m afraid it’s far too late for you now! GULP! GLUCK! GLURCH!” Link felt the throat muscles resist his struggles and shove him back into position. They squeezed him again and his head popped through a tight sphincter. Now Link found himself gazing straight into the milky, shimmering pool of liquid inside the Fairy Queen’s stomach. It was as though all the bioluminescence in her entire body was concentrated here. Link saw every wrinkle, contraction, and salivary rivulet in the intense illumination. Another gulp squeezed his hips through the slippery tube. Only his feet remained in the Fairy Queen’s mouth. She carefully licked each salty toe and moaned in ecstasy. Link growled and wiggled his legs, trying to kick her front teeth but only bringing her more pleasure. “Your struggles are almost as palatable as your flavor, but I’m afraid one more gulp will pack you away for good! Au revoir, mon casse-croûte! ULLLP!”

A long, greedy swallow pushed Link’s whole body through the esophagus in one decisive motion. The enormous bulge hanging from the Fairy Queen’s neck wobbled and contracted. Her mighty muscles flexed and suddenly, the heavy, squirming form of the hero was transferred down into her tight, goopy stomach. The Queen’s upper body returned to normal, but under her dress a fleshy sphere was expanding. Her bubbling cauldron of a belly swelled magnificently, tearing through the weak fabric and leaving her with half a skirt. A Link-sized ball of flesh spilled out from the Queen’s abdomen, swinging pendulously as she hovered above the trees. She reached for the stars, licked her lips, and yawned. “Ah… How the mighty have fallen, straight into my belly that is! Ehehehehe- URP! Hey! Simmer down in there, okay?”

Link had yet to give up. He was curled into a ball, his knees pressed to his chest. The blue liquid swirled around his shins. He had taken to thrashing and kicking against the slimy, clingy viscera. The wrinkly walls barely budged, but he still made enough of a commotion to get the Queen’s attention. “Hmph! If you’re gonna play rough, I’ll have to put you in time-out, little boy!” Suddenly Link felt the organic sack tighten around him. The taut flesh held his arms and legs firmly in place, rendering him immobile. On the outside, the Queen’s lithe form sported a quivering distension in the shape of a humanoid in a fetal position. She smiled discreetly, feeling as though she was pregnant with the little hero.

“So, now that I’ve had my fun…”
1231121121211221.title: Down the Fairy Queen’s Gullet

12311211212112212.content:
“Wait, what?” By now Link was no stranger to sliding into a girl’s guts. Yet he distinctly remembered the Queen saying that he would only hear her spiel if he won. “What was the point of the game?”

“For fun, of course! Why else would someone play a game?”

“I guess you’re right. Thanks for not digesting me.”

“Hehe. So…” The Fairy Queen gently drifted down to the ground. She sat back against the log that Link had tried to hide in. Her gut sagged against the soil as she spread her legs apart. “You’re probably wondering why your sister suddenly gained all this ‘Power,’ huh?” Link adjusted his position in the shifting stomach folds. “The goddesses don’t talk to us fairies too often these days. I… Know they’re up there, but they’ve been quiet for a while. Which is unfortunate because on my own, I don’t know much more about the Triforce than you do. I’ve lived longer than most Hylians can fathom, but unfortunately I can’t fully understand the goddesses’ power.”

Link nodded, despite being invisible to his captress. “However,” she said, “I recall Ganondorf’s ascension using the Triforce of Power. As a boy he was very lonely. A stranger amongst his tribe and a stranger to the Kingdom of Hyrule. All he wanted was to have his emptiness filled. When he tried to steal the Triforce, it split into its three pieces, leaving him with only Power. A creature driven by fear, who wants nothing but to feel secure, is a creature who thirsts for Power. Power can fill emptiness.”

Everything Aryll had ever said shot through Link’s mind. For the first time in quite a while, he was struck by how often she proclaimed her love for him. He realized that no other person in her life meant as much to her as he did. So, what could Aryll possibly have to fear? Link already knew the answer. “It makes me feel so selfish,” he said, “but I can’t just stay on Outset forever. I’ve gained all this experience adventuring in in the world. I can’t let that go to waste. I have to push into the unknown waters.”

“But Aryll’s Power has not reached its limit. It still grows like a weed. And it wants to enfold you in its love… Like how my stomach softly churns you with its warmth, or how her stomach did. Why do you think you were cursed with reduced size? It made you easier to carry and engulf. It was just another extension of her wish to have you.”

Link sighed. “So, even if I get unshrunk and leave she’ll go crazy and chase after me? She’ll use her powers to try and contain me? …I could never fight her. I can barely process that thought.”

“You don’t have to. You simply need to satisfy her.”

“Uh…” Link blushed. “How do I do that?”

The Fairy Queen smiled and snickered. “I’ve seen your sister’s dreams. When you reach Forsaken Fortress and you find the Book of Magic… Don’t be so hasty to use it. Offer to share a feast with your sister.”

“A… Feast?”

The Queen slapped her belly. “You’ll see! Now, I’ll be sending you on your way…” At that moment Link felt the blue liquid start to rise. He struggled to stay above the surface but it quickly submerged him. Immersed in the liquid-filled sack, Link lost consciousness and blacked out…

When he awoke, he found that he was on…
12311211212112212.title: The Mysterious Triforce

123112112121122121.content:
Link was lying flat on a hard surface with his eyes shut. He was roused by a gust of cool, moist air. Vapor soaked his hair and wetted his skin. His eyes opened to a view of the gray, stormy sky and the foamy ocean waves. He knew he wasn’t on a boat- he didn’t feel the ground beneath him bobbing or swaying. Looking down he saw that the floor was made of some gray stone. His skin was not making contact with the cold ground. Raising his hand in front of his face he saw a blue sleeve covering his forearm. Apparently the Fairy Queen had re-equipped him with his casual Outset outfit.

Before Link could wonder where he was, a sweet, warm scent blew past his head. “Order up,” a mature female voice called, “One Deku Nut Cake for… Uh… Aryll?” Link jumped to his feet and spun around to behold a familiar room. The Café of Windfall Island- a cozy little restaurant that Link had visited to relax between dungeon crawls. Gonzo, Niko, and Tetra sat at the table on the far corner of the room. Aryll was walking up to the counter where Gillian, the blue-garbed waitress, awaited with a piping hot cake on a platter. Gillian looked as unhappy as ever, while Aryll looked more miserable than Link had ever seen.

Apparently the shrunken hero stood in the Café’s window. Peering inside, he watched Aryll return to the table. Thanks to the blustering winds he doubted he would be audible from his current position. Aryll sat next to Tetra, who rubbed her shoulder to comfort her. Link could hear just well enough to listen in on the ensuing conversation. “Aryll… I’m really sorry about what happened.”

She sniffled. “It’s okay. I know it wasn’t your fault. I don’t wanna blame anyone.”

Tetra’s eyes lit up. “You’re really mature for your age, you know that? A lot of kids would be freaking out and pointing fingers, but you try to view the situation objectively.”

“Th-thanks.” Aryll peered into Tetra’s eyes with a look she would give a big sister. “I just hope we can find him.”

“We will. Your brother’s one of the toughest people I’ve ever met.”

“Yeah,” Niko agreed, “I’ve seen that boy take down monsters bigger than this room. A little wind ain’t gonna keep him down.”

Gonzo nodded without a sound. A smile slowly crossed Aryll’s lips. “You guys are great friends. I bet we’ll find him before tomorrow ends. Uh…” Aryll shivered as her hair swayed from a cool gust. She and the pirates looked to its source, identifying it as the window Link was standing in. “Brr, the wind from that storm is a little chilly.”

“I agree,” Gillian frankly remarked, “I’ll get the window.” Before Link could protest the barista grabbed the wooden flaps surrounding the window and slammed them shut in his face. He was knocked off the window and sent plummeting toward the ground… But fortunately, the wind carried him toward a nearby tree and he landed on a branch, wrapping his arms and legs around it. Dragging himself to his feet, he saw that the Café now stood at a distance. It would have been a quick walk for a normal sized-person but for him it was more like looking at Ganondorf’s Tower from Hyrule Castle. “I don’t remember their windows having shutters,” Link grumbled. The tree he stood on appeared to have been recently planted to the east of the Café and Zunari’s shop. It stood between the trading area and the Hall of Wealth, which Link recalled was now occupied by Maggie and her father rather than Mila and hers. Upon closer inspection, Link realized that the tree was made of Deku wood. He figured that Zunari probably imported it with rupees he made from his ridiculous auctions.

Considering that the tree came from Forest Haven or an island with a similar ecology, Link also realized what that meant for its leaves. He climbed to the end of the branch, which pointed southward- effectively a border marker for the two buildings the tree stood between. He spotted a lone leaf that was the size of his torso. He yanked it from its stem and held it above his head. “I got the Deku Leaf! …Again.” Turning toward the Café, he waited for the wind to blow at his back to he could sail back over to it. The moment he felt the current change he hopped off the branch.

Unfortunately, Link found himself whisked away by another gust that carried him off in the opposite direction. He clung to the leaf as he hurtled through the raindrops. Then he smacked face-first against a pane of glass. The leaf flew out of his grasp and drifted into the darkness. He slid down the side of the slickened ceramic wall until he reached a soggy stone floor. He slowly opened his eyes and beheld the blinding golden light of a chandelier. He looked away, realizing the windowsill he stood on was facing the ocean with nothing below it.

He then looked back into the interior of the building and saw it was decorated with posh red carpeting, ornate wooden furniture, and various paintings. The window he stood in front of was on the second floor. There was a rectangular walkway with a central opening to the first floor, and a larger lounge area with a couch toward the window. The first floor held few noteworthy sights, save for eight shiny blue vases, four on either wall. Link quickly recognized this as the Hall of Wealth, which doubled as an Auction House for economic purposes and an actual house for the Windfall nobility. He remembered that Mila and her father used to live here, before being supplanted by Maggie and hers.

Looking to his left Link spotted one of the window panes slightly opened. Left with no other choice he hurried inside, breathing a sigh of relief as the warmth washed over him. He hopped onto a table near the wall. A white doily was spread out on the surface. Link grabbed one end of it and dried himself off. He knew Maggie was a reasonably nice girl and would probably help him. The wealthy Mila who once resided in the house would probably not have given him the time of day. With her nasty attitude, she might have done something far worse. Link heard a door creak open on the left wall of the second floor. In stepped…
123112112121122121.title: Bad Luck on Windfall Island

1231121121211221212.content: Mila was dressed in her...
1231121121211221212.title: Mila's Social Standing

12311211212112212121.content:
To Link’s surprise Mila stepped into the House of Wealth trailed by a lengthy pink skirt. He remembered that dress- she was wearing it when he rescued her. She was even clutching the fluffy fan he had seen her with. Her blue crystal earrings glittered in the chandelier’s light. Her corset was tied tightly around her waist, revealing her surprisingly defined curves. Her thin, piercing eyes seemed to ignore all things inelegant as she strode across the room toward the lounge area- Link’s direction. Watching the posh giantess’s approach, Link wondered what had happened in the time he had been away from Windfall. Hadn’t Mila and her father slipped into poverty?

Unsure of what to think, Link darted behind a row of ornate plates as Mila reached the couch and took a seat. She stretched her arms as her mouth slowly opened into a black oval. “Yaawwwwwn. I forgot how busy my life could be when I lived here. But I guess having three meals and a warm bed is a fair trade for learning… well… trade.” She picked up a teapot set on the table, shaking it and frowning when she realized it was empty. “And to think that Zunari just has to have those auctions each and every night. With those pirates about it’s sure to be noisier than ever. If he wasn’t the key to this island’s economic stability I’d bet my father would ballot for his banishment. He can be such a pain… Hm?” Her eyes were suddenly drawn toward the window. “What’s that reflection?”

Link staggered backward. He turned around and saw a mirror image of himself in the clear glass, courtesy of the powerful chandelier light. He also saw the giantess’s reflection standing up and growing massively as she approached him. “Is that… It looks just like a person… But that can’t be possible. Hm? He even looks kind of like that one boy I once knew…” As Mila’s slender fingers hovered over the plate descended upon Link, he darted away from their careful grasp. “Hey! It moved!” Mila’s hand dexterously swooped in and snatched Link just as he neared the table’s edge. She brought him before her icy stare and examined him closely. “This is impossible… I’ve seen you before, when I was poor. How did you get so small? And what kind of tailor made such tiny clothing?”

“Er, it’s a long story,” Link said, awkwardly moving his arms in his soggy outfit, “So, I see you and your dad got the place back.”

“Hm, yes, it was truly only a matter of time before that idiotic father of Maggie’s spent all his earnings. With the power vacuum he created my father & I were quick to reclaim our place. What an odd old man… Though I must admit, Maggie makes for some delightful conversation.” Link was confused. He remembered Mila’s sass when she worked at Zunari’s shop (and tried to steal from it). He had never had a conversation with her formal side. “Your name was Link, was it not?”

“Yup, an Ally of Justice, remember?”

“Indeed. But you still haven’t answered my question.”

“Oh, right. It sounds crazy, but my sister acquired some magical powers and she accidentally shrunk me. I ended up here because I was captured by the fairy queen, but when she warped me here I got caught on a current of wind. That’s how I ended up in here.”

Mila arched an eyebrow. “Link, I…”
12311211212112212121.title: Rich Girl

123112112121122121212.content:
“I don’t believe you.” Mila’s face held not a shred of humor.

“Wha? Trust me it’s true!”

Mila chuckled. “I am impressed that you were able to create such an elaborate story, but it is meaningless. It’s obvious you concocted a way to shrink yourself so you could sneak in here and steal from us. I long suspected you were one of the parasites who claim to be virtuous, but in the end you only serve yourselves.”

“But I saved you!”

“For the reward, obviously. Those pirates you associate with bled my father dry. Then I had to work for that irritating man…”

“But I talked you out of stealing from him that one time!”

“And you only did so just to remove me as an obstacle and take Zunari’s money for yourself. Did you really think he wouldn’t notice that his safe was missing hundreds of rupees?” She tightened her grip around Link. He coughed as the air left his lungs. “And can you guess who was blamed for that?”

Link struggled to respond under the pressure of the godlike girl’s grip. “I- didn’t- do- it…”

“I’m sick of your lies, Link. You really are just another parasite who sucks at our underbelly, unable to appreciate the elegance and beauty of what we’ve built. And the only way to deal with a parasite…” Mila began walking, with Link held to her hip. He saw she was heading for a red door that he had not noticed before. She pushed it open with the fist around his body, apparently valuing her fan more than his comfort. Link had a new appreciation for Aryll’s gentleness. Behind the door sat a massive, red-sheeted bed, large enough for four people but designed for one. “…is to exterminate it.” She brought him before her imposing visage again. “Which means I… Get to have some fun.”

Link shuddered to think what cruel things she could have in store. “Can’t we talk about this?”

“I’m afraid not, little spy. Although,” she sniffed at him, “you smell of dirt and rain. I must rectify this.” Mila took Link into a washroom through a door that was connected to her bedroom. She dipped him into a water basin and quickly scrubbed away the dirt and grime he was covered in. Mila then brought him back into the bedroom and stood next to the bed. She held him before her face. He was stark naked in one hand, while his clothes sagged pathetically in the other. “But why,” Link asked, “why even clean me?”

Mila licked her lips. “Because my way of disposing of you will involve some rather intimate contact.” Link heard a low groan behind Mila’s corset. “But how, exactly, will I go about this…?”
123112112121122121212.title: Who's the Thief Here, Exactly?

choices: Mila is interrupted by some noise downstairs
1231121121211221212122.content:
Mila’s eyelashes fluttered, her mouth obscured behind her fan. “You know, Link, when I was a toddler I had some rather deviant tendencies… Many of my dolls vanished. It bothered my parents quite a bit, especially when they found out where they were ending up…”

Link scoffed. “What, down your throat, into your stomach? Whatever, I’ve been eaten plenty of times now.”

Mila winked and giggled behind her fan. “Hahahaha… Yes, many of those toys did find their way into my stomach. But the way they got there was rather interesting.”

“…Huh?”

“As a girl I stumbled into a book on the practices of survivalists. Some took to storing items inside their bodies, using every little orifice. The thought excited me for reasons I couldn’t explain. Before long, I was pushing larger and larger objects into my rectum, allowing my intestines to suck them deeper inside of me. You will be my first live subject.”

Link felt his whole body turn to ice. She couldn’t be serious… Could she? Mila set her fan down on the nightstand by her bedside, revealing her sadistic grin. “W-wait,” the boy stammered, “Can’t we talk about this!?”

Mila’s pupils expanded. Her heart pounded. “Oh… You’re pleading. I always pretended that my dolls were squirming in my grasp, fighting to escape my body. And now I have you… Your fear is real… Your struggles will be real… Mmmgh. This is going to feel so GOOD.”

“Mila, please,” Link wrestled against her thumb, trying to push himself out of her grasp, “I really don’t want to be shoved up someone’s butt!”

“Heh, don’t worry, little thief… I keep my anus as clean and refined as the rest of my immaculate, feminine form.” With her open hand Mila reached behind herself and pulled up her skirt. She fiddled with her panties too loosen them up. “Now… I will engulf you!” Mila brought Link around, gripping him tightly. He saw the arch in Mila’s skirt, which was held up by her arm, hovering over a dark abyss. The shadowy outline of her white lacy panties was just barely visible. Her fingers clutched the waistband and held it open, eagerly awaiting Link’s arrival. The hero saw the darkness growing before him. He was being carried inside. “No, no, no,” Link protested as he passed under the wrinkled fringe of the skirt, “Mila, please!”

“Hmph,” the rich girl pouted, “I will always get what I want. The big devour the small, and I choose to devour you with my derriere.” With that Mila dumped Link into her panties and released the waistband. The boy was snapped back into place, sealed tightly between cotton and flesh. Mila shuddered as she felt his tiny arms and legs wriggle against her soft butt cheek. “Oh yes,” she released her dress and allowed it to fall back to the floor, “Wiggle all you can, but escape is impossible.” Link heard her and began wriggling his whole body. He wormed his way through the amorphous flesh mound in hopes of reaching the upper waistband. “Hahahaha,” Mila haughtily chuckled, “Do you think it’ll be that easy to escape your punishment?”

Link had just laid his hands on the firm band as he felt his young dominatrix begin to move. Mila sauntered over to her bed, sassily swaying her hips. She turned and plopped her butt into the mattress. Link’s progress stopped. “You aren’t going anywhere,” Mila taunted, “except deeper into me~” Link squirmed and kicked, but he was held firmly by the weight of the snobby girl’s butt. Smooshed into a tighter space, the heat was intensifying. Sweat beads slid out of Mila’s pores and dripped over Link’s body. He began to sweat as well, adding to the salty mixture. The rank stench wafting from the anus was beginning to circulate. Link had hoped that a prim girl’s anus might smell a bit better than the average butt, yet if anything her arrogance made any part of her not saturated in perfume stink even worse.

He felt the crushing pressure lessen. The waistband was lifted. Link looked up. Seeing a few rays of light enter his smelly prison filled him with hope. That hope was dashed when he saw a trio of elegant fingers form an ominous silhouette as they descended upon him. Link was pushed back into the valley of curved flesh. No matter how hard he thrashed and squirmed he could not slow his descent. All his struggles yielded were more sweat beads, which further lubricated his journey, and pleased moans from Mila. Link’s surroundings grew darker, damper, toastier, and smellier as he slipped into Mila’s buttcrack. Her fingers prodded him into the moist abyss, a wrinkly canyon of delicate flesh. Link’s struggles became increasingly aimless as the noble girl’s cheeks enfolded him.

The shrunken hero felt himself pressed against a tight, slimy puckering of dense muscle. The sphincter, reeking of sweat and oozing slimy waste, dilated open to accept him. He fought away from the rectal opening, but Mila battered him around with her fingers until his body was suspended over the humid pit. “Mila- *cough* this is disgusting! Let me out of here!”

“Mmmmmm… No, this feels so good…” Mila gave a forceful push and Link’s head popped through her firm, pulsating rectum. His torso slowly slid into the dark, hot tunnel. The slimy tube wrapped around him, forming an airtight seal around his midsection. He whipped and wriggled against the frictionless flesh. Mila’s fingers kept prodding him along until his legs vanished into her crack. As her anus closed around Link’s feet she removed her fingers and allowed her dress to fall to the floor. She shivered and moaned. By contracting her rectum and flexing her buttocks, she began working Link into her large intestine. She felt him punching and kicking her from within, yet every strike was absorbed by her elastic muscle. His struggles were such a wonderful sensation after years of “absorbing” inanimate objects. Every intestinal undulation drew him deeper into the steaming depths .The further he was drawn the more frantic he became.

Link was lost in Mila’s intestinal labyrinth. None of his struggles slowed his progress into the smelly wet blackness. He had rounded so many corners in the pulsating tube that he was no longer sure of his position in the rich girl’s body. Abruptly he was squeezed from the tight, sweltering tunnel through an even tighter visceral packet. The contractions became more violent, moving him faster than before. Wiggling flesh strands lined the walls, flicking him along and hastening his journey further. Link had stopped struggling as moving his limbs had become impossible. The firm, damp walls restricted any movement. He hurtled through the twisting and turning tubes, faster and faster, tighter and tighter, until the pressure suddenly released. He was spat into an enormous empty chamber.

As Link was being transferred through Mila’s intestinal tract, she had been removing her complicated pink dress. Mila now stood barefoot in her milky white nightgown. She smiled and shuddered as she felt the tiny body squirm its way into her stomach folds. She then held up his blue shirt and orange pants. In the process of washing Link, she had ended up washing his clothing as well. “Hmph. I suppose I owe him some modicum of kindness.” Without another word Mila popped Link’s clothes into her mouth and gulped them down. She poked her belly and chuckled. “There you go, ‘hero.’ One last act of mercy from your better.” She reached to the ceiling and yawned, hoping for a good night’s sleep with the pleasurable movements of the thief inside her…
1231121121211221212122.title: Noble Butt

12311211212112212121222.content:
“…BEGIN!”

Mila was just about to relax in bed and drift off to sleep, only for a familiar grating voice to tear her from her slumber. “Zunari,” she snarled, slowly dragging herself out of bed to give that annoying merchant a piece of her mind. She stomped toward her door. Each heavy step created a tremor inside the girl’s body. Link tumbled around the slimy walls with every quake. He heard her voice when she cursed the name of Windfall’s infamous merchant. Her anger seemed to result from a breaking of intimacy. Link didn’t know much about the inner machinations of women’s minds, but he knew that what came next would not be pretty. By now he was quite familiar with the internal structure of women’s stomachs, however. He had even managed to enter one from the exit. He wasn’t sure if that was something to be proud of.

The raging rich girl slammed her door open. The moment her door smacked against the wall the sounds of conversation on the lower floor vanished. “ZUNARI! I am trying to sleep!” She peered over the railing and saw everyone looking up at her. There were the usual Windfall suspects, from Linda to Garrickson to Gummy. And then there were two blonde-haired girls who Mila recognized. The older one was more of a mystery- a pirate, one who had assisted Link in rescuing her. For the money, obviously... though she supposed that it was nice of Link to help her. But then there was the younger one in the maroon-colored skull dress. That one was from her imprisonment. What was her name…? She didn’t talk about much besides her “big brother,” whoever that was. Mila vaguely remembered the girl describing her brother, but… That had been nearly a year, and she really didn’t care.

…Come to think of it, that specific shade of yellow was quite similar to Link’s. And when Link appeared alongside the pirates, rescuing them before taking the rest of her father’s money, what was it that the younger one cried? Mila felt the sudden urge to slap herself in the face. “Wait,” she called, “isn’t your name Aryll?”

Deep inside Mila’s bowels, Link’s ears perked up when he heard his sister’s name reverberate through the sweltering chamber. He sat with his back to a slickened wall. He had laid his Outset clothes out in front of himself. Putting them back on wouldn’t make much sense in here, with the heat and stickiness. He could survive the inside of an active volcano with the Triforce of Courage, so a snooty girl’s guts were certainly doable. But survival was one thing, Link wanted to escape. Striking Mila’s stomach folds without weapons would probably only tickle her, so Link didn’t even bother. His options seemed limited. He tried to think of where Mila could be, and based on “Zunari” and “Aryll,” the only possibility seemed to be the auction room.

“Zunari,” Link thought to himself. He remembered trading with him for several pieces of useful gear, but what of it could help him now? “Wait,” Link realized, “the Magic Armor!” Link recalled one of the few items he hadn’t needed to physically wield. As a reward Zunari granted him a diamond-shaped artifact. When he touched it he gained the power to manifest a protective coating of volatile purple energy. The actual item was not needed to activate the armor. Link knew he had more than enough magic energy to do it. Striking Mila’s gastric viscera with an electrified layer coating his skin would get her attention, if nothing else.

Back outside, Aryll’s eyebrows rose as she heard her name called by such a luxurious, important-looking girl. Wracked with nerves, she bowed. “Um, yes, I am Aryll,” the young girl stammered, “I, um, apologize, if we were too loud. I was just looking for my brother.”

Mila’s face turned white.

Tetra nodded. “Yeah, we heard from that depressed guy on the steps that a “tiny blue fairy” flew into this house. We were just gonna ask Zunari if he had heard anything about it. Have you seen any ‘tiny blue fairies’ lately?”

Mila fidgeted with her hands. “Um… Ah!” The girl suddenly cringed. A burning feeling erupted within her abdomen. It was centered on her bellybutton. It stung periodically, slowly rising in temperature, becoming increasingly difficult to ignore. Mila clutched her stomach. A low groan rose up within her. Her stomach swelled, inflating with some kind of warm energy. She bit her lip. The heat made her belly feel like a bubbling stewpot. And like any stewpot, steam rose from it and flowed through the chimney- her esophagus. A packet of hot air slithered its way up her throat. It made a small bulge on her neck that displayed its journey.

“Hurk.” Mila shut her maw as tightly as possible.
12311211212112212121222.title: Mila is interrupted by some noise downstairs

choices: Shrinking her and feeding her to Link
123112112121122121212221.content:
Mila’s cheeks bulged out like a pair of peach-colored balloons. She tilted her head back, desperate to swallow the air packet down. But the pressure built tighter… tighter… Until her maw flung open and released an enormous “BURRRAP!” that echoed dissonantly through the auction hall. Mila fell to her knees and coughed. Tears fell from her eyes. “That… hurt! …Ow…” Mila wanted to curse Link for his impudence. But a more pressing matter was right before her eyes. The blue shirt and orange pants once belonging to the hero were gently drifting past the railing. The wealthy girl could only watch as the clothes drifted gently down. Her heart sank as she watched Aryll reach up and grab the falling articles.

Tetra looked upon the tiny clothing in shock. “Hey… Isn’t that Link’s…?”

Aryll was shaking. She stared blankly at the saliva-drenched shirt and pants in her hands. “Wh-what happened… to my big brother?” She peered upward. Mila was visibly alarmed. “You,” Aryll pointed, frowning, “you ate my big brother?”

“Um, w-well…”

Aryll’s hands became fists. “Give him back.”

“I-I…”

Aryll grit her teeth. Her hair began to rustle, as though a slight gust was blowing on it. A deep red energy began emanating from her skin. “I said give him back!” Aryll vanished in an explosion of red smoke and lightning. Everyone in the auction house, save for Tetra, screamed and scattered. In no time at all an identical explosion flared up on the second floor, directly in front of Mila. Aryll’s skull dress billowed in the crimson cloud. Mila staggered backwards, reaching for her bedroom door. “Um… As exciting as this night has been, I have to go!” Mila swung the door open and dashed through, hoping she could reach her family’s provisional exit before Aryll caught up with her.

“Oh, no you don’t,” the hero’s sister growled, “Come back here!”

Mila slammed her door shut and locked it in pure desperation. She backed away and began searching for the lever that would raise her bed and reveal a trapdoor. “Where did they leave that thing,” she muttered as she tried to push her dresser. She stopped as she heard a deep rumble, like thunder, directly behind her door. A wave of red energy blew the door right off its hinges. It fell over like a tree, landing with a thud. Mila saw Aryll standing in the doorway. She shivered in abject terror. The young girl began inching toward her. Mila looked at the fallen door and pointed. “Um, you’re gonna have to pay for that!” Aryll continued moving. Mila skittered away, her back against the wall. “P-please don’t kill me!”

Aryll froze. She cocked her head, then her blank expression began to curl into a smile. “I don’t wanna kill anyone. I just want my brother back,” she raised her hand, which glowed with red sparks, and formed a fist, “so give him back!” Aryll lunged forth and punched Mila right in her gut. The wealthy girl gagged, spitting all over the floor. She fell forward and landed flat on her face with a dull thud. Aryll slowly walked around the fallen girl, standing off to her left. Mila turned her head in Aryll’s direction and heaved. A bulge shot up her throat, leaving her mouth as a ball of saliva containing Link. He slid out of her cheek and rolled out onto the floor. “Ow,” Mila groaned, “I could have thrown him up my… ouff… self…” Aryll quickly kneeled down and picked Link up. She formed a bowl with her hands and allowed him to slide down into the dip. He quickly sat up and wiped the fluids off his face. Aryll’s eyes lit up.

“Big brother, you’re okay! You’re, huh,” Aryll sniffed at the air, “you kind of stink… What happened?”

“Ugh… I’d rather not talk about it.”

“Well, that’s fine! Give me a sec.” Red electricity coursed through her hands. A sphere of energy enveloped Link. Its powerful warmth caused his hair to stand on end. Then it vanished and left him warm and clean. He held up his arms and marveled at how spotless he had become after being shoved up Mila’s ass. “Thanks Aryll. Your powers have really gotten stronger, huh?”

“Yup,” Aryll giggled. She then noticed that Mila was no longer in front of her. Turning to her left she saw that the wealthy girl had begun crawling away. “I think that mean girl deserves a little more punishment, don’t you?”

Mila froze. Her head turned back, her eyes bulging in terror. “Um,” Link wondered. Despite being inserted into her anus he didn’t want to hurt Mila too badly. He also wouldn’t be able to stop her if she chose to take an unpleasant revenge. “I don’t know. Just don’t go too crazy, okay?”

“Okay,” Aryll said, not really listening to her brother. She thought of how Mila could be punished, ultimately settling on…

The wolf moved back to the children and looked over them, “mmm, they all smell and look delicious” Link thought. But for some reason he kept coming back to Colin, who had recently taken a job at the local bakers and was giving off the wonderful scent of baked bread mixed with little boy.

It was decided, Colin would be Link’s first meal.

“What are you trying to show us Link?” the boy asked as Link moved closer towards him, becoming a little nervous as he looked at the wolf’s hungry eyes. He couldn’t help but be a little scared around the animal, even though he knew Link would never hurt him.

How wrong he was.

The wolf pounced on Colin, knocking the boy to the floor and trapping him beneath his thick muscle. “I think he wants to fight you” Talo laughed, although he quickly shut up as Link opened his jaws wide and spread them over Colin’s head.

The last thing the boy ever saw was the moist pinkness of the wolf’s mouth before it encased him in darkness. “Wait, Link!” he cried out, barely audible over the loud suckling and growling sounds of the predator as it tasted him. His nostrils filled with hot wolf breath and his eyes with saliva as the wolf pulled him in further and further towards the stomach.

Link’s eyes closed for a moment as he took in the boy’s delicious taste and scent, drool leaking from the sides of his mouth and splashing on the ground below. Colin already had a delicious human flavour and smell which was wonderfully complimented by his recent baking job.

The wolf quickly bolted down the rest of his meal, past the boy’s rump and up to his kicking feet. Link used his forepaws to remove Colin’s shoes and socks, he wouldn’t need them where he was going. The wolf’s tongue coiled out and curled around the bare feet, tasting them one last time before Link raised his head to heavens and swallowed down the last of his meal.

Colin spilled into the tight stomach, coughing as his lungs and nostrils filled with hot, rancid air. “Please Link, let me out” he cried, pushing against the squishy wolf innards, but Link wasn’t listening. He was too busy licking his chops for the last remnants of Colin’s exquisite flavour and listening to the boy’s futile begging.

While Link was devouring Colin the other children had run up the stairs and were banging on the door, “please help us” they cried “Link’s gone insane!” but no one could hear them from the basement.

Link nuzzled his huge stomach, the little boy wriggling feebly within, and looked at the other children. Colin was nice, but now it was time for the next course of his meal…

Who does he go for next?

Sunlight shed its last tears on Hyrule, slowly....silently. Soft pink cherry blossoms fluttered onto the pond and swept across the doorway of the fishing hole. What a great place for a guy who loved fishing to come and relax after a day's work.

Link surely hoped the place was still open after sunset. He had a little difficulties getting here before the suin set, but at least now he knew where the secluded place rested. A casual knock on the door was answered with a cheerful "Come in!"
A woman. How lovely... ooh how delightful.

Link strode inside, joy doubling as he saw she was completely alone. He carried a disarming smile to elude the presence of his new weapon- a wonderful, belly-filing spell. "Heya, i was hoping to get in some fishing?" He smiled, leaning against the desk. The girl smiled back naturally, backing her breasts away from his closer face. "Well, that's what most guys come for!" She laughed, hoping she was right. Link only grinned.

Now, its 20 rupees to lure fish, but since you're new here i'll throw in the tour guide for free!" She seemes pleased at that. Apparently she was the one to tour him. "Who's the tour?' He asked, wanting to be sure.
"Its me, Hena."
"No one else works here?"
"Nope."
"Just you?"
"Yup!"
Link bit his lip in blissful anxiety. All alone.... how sweetly wonderful. "You are a strong-willed woman, working by yourself with all these men coming in!" Hena appeared annoyed, but covered it with a wry smile. "Well, most men should know manners, especially around me." She snorted. "Are you gonna pay or what? If not get out of here, i don't want you ogling."
Link looked at her incredulously. "Ogling? Why, who would do such a thing." He glanced at her hellishly, mouth suddenly glowing blue inside.
